vacalus: <entryFree id="n50044" type="main" key="Va^ca^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Văcălus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50044.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river of Gaul</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tributary to the Rhine</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">the Wahal</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 10</bibl>; called also Vahalis, q. v.</sense></entryFree>
vacans: <entryFree id="n50045" type="main" key="va^cans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">văcans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of vaco.</entryFree>
vacanter: <entryFree id="n50046" type="main" key="va^canter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">văcanter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. vaco, <sense id="n50046.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
vacatio: <entryFree id="n50047" type="main" key="va^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">văcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vaco</etym>, <sense id="n50047.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a being free</hi> from a duty, service, etc.; <hi rend="ital">freedom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exemption</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immunity; a freeing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exempting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dispensation</hi> (class.; syn. immunitas). </sense><sense id="n50047.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50047.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n50047.3" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen. obj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vacatio omnium munerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:20:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 20, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">publici muneris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sumptus, laboris, militiae, rerum denique omnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:10:section=23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 10, § 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">militiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:19:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 19, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:9:12" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 9, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quinquennii militiae vacatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 20, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:33:4" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 33, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum omnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:22:section=58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 22, § 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 85:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 85, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50047.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a causis vacatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:4:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab belli administratione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:32:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 32, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab opere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:14:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 14, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a sacerdotio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:12:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 12, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50047.5" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">quominus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vacationem augures, quominus judiciis operam darent, non habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:31:117" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 31, 117</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50047.6" n="(d)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">falsum est, ob vacationem pretium datum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum sacerdotes deorum vacationem habeant, quanto est aequius habere ipsos deos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 38, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deprecari vacationem adulescentiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 12, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum gestarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 9, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 7, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50047.7" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n50047.8" n="1" level="3"> (Sc. militiae.) <hi rend="ital">Exemption from military service</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">P. Vatinius ... et agro a senatu et vacatione donatus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:2:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">delectum habere sublatis vacationibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:12:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 12, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatus decrevit, ut ... dilectus haberetur, vacationes ne valerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 19, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scribere exercitum sine ullā vacationis veniā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 20, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:28:3" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 28, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:38:3" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 38, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">locupletissimus quisque miles labore fatigari, donec vacationem emeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 46</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50047.9" n="2" level="3"> (Sc. culpae.) Neque ei suam vacationem eripio, quā ille apud omnis utitur, ut nihil malitiose fecisse videntur, <hi rend="ital">freedom from blame</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:7:68:section=164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 7, 68, § 164</bibl> B. and K. (dub.; al. purgationem; al. culpae vacationem).— </sense><sense id="n50047.10" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a sum paid for exemption from military service</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vacationes annuas exsolvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vacationes centurionibus ex fisco numerat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 58</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vacca: <entryFree id="n50048" type="main" key="vacca1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vacca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. vacā, cow; root vaç, to bellow; cf. vagire</etym>, <sense id="n50048.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cow</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:21:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 21, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 27</bibl> 77; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 9, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:524" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 524</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 177</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:694" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 694</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 2, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">boves operariae, used in ploughing,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:24" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 24</bibl></cit>. 4; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:20:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 20, 4</bibl>. <pb n="1950" /> <cb n="VACI" /></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n50049" type="main" key="Vacca2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vacca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n50049.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town of Byzacene in Africa</hi>, Auct. B. Afr. 74.—</sense><sense id="n50049.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town of Numidia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also Vaga</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Beja</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 29:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 29, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:47:1" default="NO" valid="yes">47, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:68:3" default="NO" valid="yes">68, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:259" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 259</bibl>. —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vaccensis</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vagensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Vacca</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vagense oppidum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Vaga</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 4, 4, § 30</bibl></cit>.— <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vaccenses</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Vagen-</orth>), <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Vacca</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 66:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 66, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n50050" type="main" key="Vacca3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vacca</orth>, v. Vagia.</entryFree>
vaccaei: <entryFree id="n50051" type="main" key="Vaccaei"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vaccaei</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50051.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of</hi> Hispania Tarraconensis, <hi rend="ital">on the river Durius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:7" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:34:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 34, 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vaccinium: <entryFree id="n50052" type="main" key="vacci_ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vaccīnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n50052.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the blueberry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whortleberry</hi>: Vaccinium myrtillus, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 18, 31, § 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 50</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:1:5" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 14, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vaccinus: <entryFree id="n50053" type="main" key="vacci_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vaccīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vacca</etym>, <sense id="n50053.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">from cows</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 12, 50, § 185</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lac,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 8, 53, § 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caseus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 14, 58, § 204</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vaccula: <entryFree id="n50054" type="main" key="vaccu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vaccŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50054.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little cow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">heifer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:20:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 20, 14</bibl>; Val. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:Dir. 132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> Dir. 132</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vaccus: <entryFree id="n50055" type="main" key="Vaccus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vaccus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>; Vitruvius Vaccus, <sense id="n50055.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a general of Fundi</hi>, <hi rend="ital">taken captive by L. Papirius.</hi> The vacant site of his house at Rome was called Vacci prata, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:19 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 19 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:38:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 38, 101</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vacefio: <entryFree id="n50056" type="main" key="va^ce_fi_o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">văcēfīo</orth>, <itype>fĭĕri</itype>, <sense id="n50056.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. pass.</hi> [vacuus-facio], <hi rend="ital">to become</hi> or <hi rend="ital">be made empty</hi> (only in the two foll. passages): <cit><quote lang="la">multusque vacefit In medio locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1005" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1005</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1017" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 1017</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vacerra: <entryFree id="n50057" type="main" key="va^cerra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">văcerra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n50057.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a log</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stock</hi>, <hi rend="ital">post.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50057.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:1:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:1:9" default="NO">9, 1, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:19:2" default="NO">6, 19, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50057.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, like stipes, and our <hi rend="ital">stock</hi>, <hi rend="ital">block</hi>, as a term of abuse applied to a stupid person: vecorde et malefica vacerra, Liy. Andron. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=375" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 375</bibl> Müll. (Com. Fragm. v. 7 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
vacerrosus: <entryFree id="n50058" type="hapax" key="va^cerro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">văcerrōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vacerra, II.</etym>, freq. used by the emperor Augustus for cerritus, <sense id="n50058.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crazed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crack-brained</hi>, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:87" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 87</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vachalis: <entryFree id="n50059" type="main" key="Va^cha^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Văchălis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, v. Vahalis.</entryFree>
vacillatio: <entryFree id="n50060" type="main" key="va^cilla_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">văcillātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vacillo</etym>, <sense id="n50060.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rocking to and fro</hi>, <hi rend="ital">see-saw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a wavering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reeling motion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">indecora in dextrum ac laevum latus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:128" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foeda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
vacillo: <entryFree id="n50061" type="main" key="va^cillo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">văcillo</orth> (<sense id="n50061.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a</hi> scanned long, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:502" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 502</bibl>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>cf. Sanscr. vak-, to roll; vank-, to shake</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to sway to and fro; to waddle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stagger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">totter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">waver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vacillate</hi> (class.; a favorite word with Cic.; cf.: nuto, titubo). </sense><sense id="n50061.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of drunken persons: quosdam ex vino vacillantes, quosdam hesternā potatione oscitantes, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:66" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 66</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">videre quosdam ex vino vacillantis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:165" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 165</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praepediuntur crure vacillanti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:479" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 479</bibl></cit>; cf. Ruhnk. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0425,001:2:7, p. 164" default="NO"><author>Rutil. Lup.</author> 2, 7, p. 164</bibl> Frotsch.: <cit><quote lang="la">in utramque partem toto corpore vacillans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:60:216" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 60, 216</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbor ventis pulsa vacillans aestuat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1096" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1096</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ambusta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:806" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 806</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vacillant omnia tecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:575" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 575</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub pedibus tellus cum tota vacillat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1236" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 1236</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accepi tuam epistulam vacillantibus litterulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 15, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50061.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to waver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hesitate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stagger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be untrustworthy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to vacillate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tota res vacillat et claudicat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:38:107" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 38, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Erotem ad ista expedienda factum mihi videbar reliquisse, cujus non sine magnā culpā vacillarunt,</quote> <trans><tr>have fallen into confusion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 18, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">justitia vacillat vel jacet potius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:33:118" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 33, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stabilitas amicitiae vacillat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:20:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 20, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legio vacillans,</quote> <trans><tr>wavering in fidelity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:12:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 12, 31</bibl></cit>: <foreign lang="greek">gerontikw/teron</foreign> est memoriola vacillare, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">partim sumptibus in vetere aere alieno vacillant,</quote> <trans><tr>are staggering beneath a load of old debts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:10:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 10, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aegrotat fama vacillans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gentes vacillantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:130:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 130, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum animus paulum vacillavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 114:22" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 114, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testes, qui adversus fidem testationis suae vacillant, audiendi non sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:5:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 22, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus (testis) ita anceps fides vacillat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:10:27" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 48, 10, 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vacive: <entryFree id="n50062" type="main" key="va^ci_ve_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">văcīvē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. vacivus <sense id="n50062.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
vacivitas: <entryFree id="n50063" type="hapax" key="va^ci_vi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">văcīvĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vacivus</etym>, <sense id="n50063.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">emptiness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lack</hi>, <hi rend="ital">want</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 40</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vacivus: <entryFree id="n50064" type="main" key="va^ci_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">văcīvus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏcīvus</orth> (so always in Plautus; cf. Trin. prol. 11 Brix; <sense id="n50064.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">Ritschl,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0594,001:Exc. I. p. 59 sq" default="NO"><author>Nov.</author> Exc. I. p. 59 sq.</bibl></cit>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vaco</etym>, <hi rend="ital">empty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">void</hi> (ante-class.); <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedes facere alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedes aurium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 54</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which, aures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:prol. 29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. prol. 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:prol. 11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. prol. 11</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: valens afflictet me vocivum virium, i. e. <cb n="VACO" /> <hi rend="ital">destitute of strength</hi>, <hi rend="ital">powerless</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 2, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus laboris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 38</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">văcīvē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">at leisure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leisurely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">libellum perlegere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5</bibl></cit>, praef. 14.</sense></entryFree>
vaco: <entryFree id="n50065" type="main" key="va^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">văco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype> (<sense id="n50065.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> vacui, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pud. 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Val. 9</bibl>), <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>etym. dub.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to be empty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">void</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">vacant; to be void of</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">without; not to contain</hi> (class.; cf.: careo, egeo). </sense><sense id="n50065.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n50065.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of space, etc. </sense><sense id="n50065.3" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quācumque vacat spatium, quod inane vocamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:507" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 507</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">spatium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1053" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 1053</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1029" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 1029</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inane,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:520" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 520</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">villa ita completa militibus est, ut vix triclinium ... vacaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:52:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 52, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tota domus superior vacat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 12, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maximam putant esse laudem, quam latissime a suis finibus vacare agros,</quote> <trans><tr>to be uninhabited</tr>, <tr>uncultivated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:118" default="NO">9, 4, 118</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:33" default="NO">10, 3, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostia septem Pulverulenta vacant, septem sine flumine valles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:256" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 256</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odi cum late splendida cera vacat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:11:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 11, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec fiunt dum vacat harena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 7:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 7, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50065.4" n="2" level="3"> With <case>abl.</case> (so most freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">illa natura caelestis et terra vacat et umore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:26:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 26, 65</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:24:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 24, 64</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens vacans corpore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 10, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoste vacare domos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(domus) quae Igne vacet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:764" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 764</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">custode vacans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:422" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 422</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora vacent epulis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>abstain from</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:478" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 478</bibl></cit>: ea pars oppidi, quae fluminis circuitu vacabat, Auct. B. G. 8, 41. —</sense><sense id="n50065.5" n="3" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec a custodiis classium loca maxime vacabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 25</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n50065.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to be vacant. free from</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unoccupied</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n50065.7" n="1" level="3"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejusmodi (nimiis animi) motibus sermo debet vacare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:38:136" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 38, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla vitae pars vacare officio potest,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omni curatione et administratione rerum (dii),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:11:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 11, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curā et negotio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:3:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">culpā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">criminibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:34" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">febri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 14 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:53" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 1, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplitudo animi pulchrior, si vacet populo,</quote> <trans><tr>keeps free from</tr>, <tr>remains aloof from</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:26:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 26, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">respublica et milite illic et pecuniā vacet,</quote> <trans><tr>be free from the necessity of furnishing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:48:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 48, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50065.8" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullum tempus illi umquam vacabat aut a forensi dictione aut a scribendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:78:272" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 78, 272</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(rex) quicquid a bellis populi Romani vacabat, cum hominibus nostris consuetudines jungebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:9:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 9, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a publico officio et munere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:2:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab opere (milites),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quando a metu ac periculis vacarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vacant ab imbecillis valetudinaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:3:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a culpā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 97:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 97, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a periculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 6:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Q. N. 6, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a negotiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3</bibl></cit> prol.—</sense><sense id="n50065.9" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n50065.10" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To be free from labor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not busied</hi>, <hi rend="ital">idle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at leisure; to have leisure</hi> or <hi rend="ital">time</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamvis occupatus sis, otii tamen plus habes: aut, si ne tu quidem vacas, noli, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:30:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 30, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 13, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">festus in pratis vacat otioso Cum bove pagus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:18:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 18, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si vacabis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:38:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 38, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si forte vacas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 95</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50065.11" n="2" level="3"> After the Aug. per. esp. freq. </sense><sense id="n50065.12" n="a" level="4"> Vacare alicui rei, <hi rend="ital">to be free to attend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apply</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">devote one's self to</hi> something; <hi rend="ital">to have leisure</hi> or <hi rend="ital">time for</hi> a thing (cf. studeo): <cit><quote lang="la">philosophiae, Quinte, semper vaco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:6:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 6, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in itinere, quasi solutus ceteris curis, huic uni vacaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic uni negotio vacare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:114:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 114, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille non vacasse sermoni suo regem causatus discessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:7:21" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paulum etiam palaestricis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 11, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studio operis pulcherrimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:114" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clientium negotiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non discendo tantum juri, sed etiam docendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libellis legendis ac rescribendis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:45" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">queruntur de superiorum fastidio, quod ipsis adire volentibus non vacaverint,</quote> <trans><tr>have no leisure for them</tr>, <tr>can not attend to them</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 2:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Brev. Vit. 2, 5</bibl></cit>.—Rarely <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum perago tecum pauca sed apta, vaca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 2, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50065.13" n="b" level="4"> Vacare ad aliquid: <cit><quote lang="la">non vaco ad istas ineptias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 49:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 49, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">in grande opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:3:36" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 3, 36</bibl></cit>; also, with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sternere acies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:185" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 185</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50065.14" n="c" level="4"> Vacat (alicui), <hi rend="ital">impers.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">there is time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">room</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">leisure for</hi> a thing (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n50065.15" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (so most freq.): si primā repetens ab origine <cb n="VACU" /> pergam Et vacet annales nostrorum audire laborum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:373" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 373</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc et elegiam vacabit in manus sumere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:58" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non vacabit incohare haec studia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 12, 12</bibl></cit>: hactenus indulsisse vacat, <hi rend="ital">it is permitted</hi>, i. q. licet, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:625" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 625</bibl> Heyne; imitated by <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:374" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 17, 374</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50065.16" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>dat.</case>, <hi rend="ital">I</hi> (<hi rend="ital">thou</hi>, <hi rend="ital">he</hi>, etc.) <hi rend="ital">have leisure</hi> or <hi rend="ital">time for</hi> a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">nobis venari nec vacat nec libet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non vacat exiguis rebus adesse Jovi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:216" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 216</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec nostris praebere vacet tibi cantibus aures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:334" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 5, 334</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obstat enim diligentiae scribendi etiam fatigatio et abunde, si vacet, lucis spatia sufficiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui esse diserto vacet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 1, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo magis te, cui vacat, hortor, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:10:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 15, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:10:12" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 10, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:15:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 15, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:124:1" default="NO">2, 124, 1</bibl>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">teneri properentur amores, Dum vacat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:1:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 1, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si vacat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:21" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 21</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n50065.17" n="B" level="2"> Of possessions, lands, etc., <hi rend="ital">to be unoccupied</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vacant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ownerless</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum agri Ligustini ... aliquantum vacaret, senatūs consultum est factum, ut is ager viritim divideretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundi possessionem nancisci, quae ex neglegentiā domini vacat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:3:37" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 41, 3, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si nemo sit, bona vacabunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:7:2" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 38, 7, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n50065.18" n="2" level="3"> Esp., of offices, relations, positions, employments, etc., <hi rend="ital">to be vacant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without incumbent</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">si Piso adesset, nullius philosophiae vacaret locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:7:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 7, 16</bibl></cit>: quid enim nostrā victum esse Antonium, si victus est, ut alii vacaret, quod ille obtinuit? <hi rend="ital">may stand open</hi>, Brut. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ep. ad Brut. 1, 17, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rogo ut Suram praeturā exornare digneris, cuia locus vacet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 12</bibl></cit> (7), 1: <cit><quote lang="la">rogo dignitati... vel auguratum vel septemviratum, quia vacant, adicere digneris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 10:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 13</bibl></cit> (8).— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">văcans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n50065.19" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Empty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unoccupied</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without an owner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vacant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Marc. 16:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Marc. 16, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">metaphora ... vacantem locum occupare debet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:4:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 42, 4, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:25:2:4" default="NO">25, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27:3:1" default="NO">27, 3, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">saltus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:477" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 477</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">balneae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30:1:93" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 30, 1, 93</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30:1:111" default="NO">30, 1, 111</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">văcantia</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">vacant estates</hi>, <hi rend="ital">property without an owner</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut, si a privilegiis parentum cessaretur, velut parens omnium populus vacantia teneret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50065.20" n="B" level="2"> Of women, <hi rend="ital">single</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unmarried</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without a husband</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui vacantem mulierem rapuit vel nuptam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:6:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 6, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 262" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 262</bibl> (cf. vacua, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:20:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 20, 149</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n50065.21" n="C" level="2"> Of persons, <hi rend="ital">at leisure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unoccupied</hi>, <hi rend="ital">idle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec petiit animum vacantem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:612" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 612</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">văcantĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">that which is superfluous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">useless</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">vacantia ex quāque re ac non necessariā auferre et excidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:5:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 5, 6</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vă-canter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">superfluously</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:10:16" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 10, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vacue: <entryFree id="n50066" type="main" key="va^cu^e_1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">văcŭē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. vacuus <sense id="n50066.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n50067" type="main" key="va^cu^e_2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">văcŭē-făcĭo</orth>, <itype>fēci, factum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>vacuus</etym>, <sense id="n50067.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make empty; to empty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">free.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50067.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quid quod adventu tuo ista subsellia vacuefacta sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum novis nuptiis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Scyrum vacuefecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,005:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Cim. 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,020:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Timol. 3, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fasces securibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:1:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turpi sentinā exercitus vacuefactus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:7:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venas inedia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locum alicui in cenā,</quote> <trans><tr>to clear a place</tr>, <tr>make room</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50067.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumcisiones,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to abolish</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 17, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vacuitas: <entryFree id="n50068" type="main" key="va^cu^i^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">văcŭĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n50068.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, concr., <hi rend="ital">empty space</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a vacancy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vacuity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">interveniorum vacuitates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50068.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a being without</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a freedom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">absence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exemption from</hi> any thing (class.; cf. vacatio). </sense><sense id="n50068.2" n="1" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberatio et vacuitas omnis molestiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:11:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 11, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">doloris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 16</bibl></cit>; 2, 6, 18; 2, 11, 35; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 12, 37: aegritudinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:14:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 14, 42</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50068.3" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">vacuitas ab angoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:21:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 21, 73</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50068.4" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">a vacancy</hi> in an office: consulum, Brut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 10, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vacuna: <entryFree id="n50069" type="main" key="Va^cu_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Văcūna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vacuus, II. A.</etym>, <sense id="n50069.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the goddess of rural leisure</hi>, esp. honored by the Sabines, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 49</bibl> Acr.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:307" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 307</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 12, 17, § 109</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 4, 98</bibl>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Văcūnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Vacuna</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">foci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:308" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 308</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vacuo: <entryFree id="n50070" type="main" key="va^cu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">văcŭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>vacuus</etym>, <sense id="n50070.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make empty</hi> or <hi rend="ital">void; to empty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">free</hi> (mostly post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">locus inanitus ac vacuatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1023" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1023</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sulcum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:13:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 13, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolia a mercatoribus vacuata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:50:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 50, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Elysium nemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:5:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 5, 6</bibl></cit>: saecula putr: <pb n="1951" /> <cb n="VACU" /> penso, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:642" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 642</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguine vacuatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Epit. 43" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Epit. 43</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vacuus: <entryFree id="n50071" type="main" key="va^cu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">văcŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vaco</etym>, <sense id="n50071.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">empty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">void</hi>, <hi rend="ital">free</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">devoid of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without</hi> something (freq. and class.; cf. inanis.) </sense><sense id="n50071.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n50071.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, in material sense. </sense><sense id="n50071.3" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">spatium vacuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:523" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 523</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:394" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 394</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:509" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 509</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vacua castra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perque domos Ditis vacuas et inania regna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:269" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 269</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 379</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 528: porticus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 761</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">videntur Aëra per vacuum ferri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Acerrae,</quote> <trans><tr>unpeopled</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 225</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cumae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:2" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ulubrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:102" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:592" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 12, 592</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 515</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppida, Auct. B. Afr. 9: aliquam partem aedium vacuam facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aër,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:3:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 3, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">theatrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:14:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 4, 14, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerus peditum in vicem prolapsorum equitum vacuos capientium ad pugnam equos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:26:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 26, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:2:1" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:471" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 471</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">per vacuum locum inruperunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:42" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ossa vacuis exsucta medullis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:90" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 90</bibl></cit>: si vacuo ventre mulier fuit, <hi rend="ital">not pregnant</hi> (opp. plenus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:2:84" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 29, 2, 84</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus,</quote> <trans><tr>without eyes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip. 1012" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oedip. 1012</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50071.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil igni vacuum videri potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladium vaginā vacuum in urbe non vidimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Marcell. 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moenia defensoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:63:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 63, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viae occursu hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:41:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 41, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cultoribus agri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:653" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 653</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ense ebur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:148" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arvum arboribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:11:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca fetu in vite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:10:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 10, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectus velamine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:593" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 593</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50071.5" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">Messana ab his rebus...vacua ac nuda est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:2:section=3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 2, § 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppidum vacuum ab defensoribus,</quote> <trans><tr>without</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars Galliae ab exercitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:46" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vacuum ab hostibus mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 13, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50071.6" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> (rare; mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">ager aridus et frugum vacuus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 90:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 90, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romana urbs annonae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mamert.</author> Grat. Act. ad Julian. 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50071.7" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vă-cŭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an empty space</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an open</hi> or <hi rend="ital">vacant place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a void</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vacuity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vacuum minus intus habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:367" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 367</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in vacuum poterunt se extendere rami,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:287" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 287</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne per vacuum incurreret hostis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libera per vacuum posui vestigia princeps,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50071.8" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">free from</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">devoid of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50071.9" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus per somnum sensibus et curis vacuus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:11:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 11, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">molestiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupiditate et timore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:10:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 10, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium periculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum vacui curis etiam quid in caelo fiat scire avemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:14:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 14, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vacui negotiis vivere possimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his rebus mens vacua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:4:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vacuus duellis Janus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:15:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 15, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimine nox vacua est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:581" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 581</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille metu vacuus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:582" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 3, 582</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullum tempus sterile et vacuum beneficio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:56:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 56, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aemulatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curā domesticā vacuus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tali culpā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tributo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vacuam laboribus egi vitam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:3:9" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 3, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50071.10" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mamertini soli vacui, expertes, soluti ac liberi fuerunt ab omni sumptu, molestiā, munere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:10:section=23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 10, § 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a securibus et tributis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">12, 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hora nulla vacua a furto, a scelere, crudelitate, flagitio reperietur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:12:section=34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 12, § 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullus dies ab exercitationibus oratoriis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:90:309" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 90, 309</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus a talibus factis vacuus et integer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:7:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 7, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ab omni molestiā vacuus esses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 11, 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus a suspitione religionis vacua atque pura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab odio, amicitiā, irā atque misericordiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a culpa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 4</bibl></cit>: censores vacui ab operum locandorun; <cit><quote lang="la">curā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 18, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50071.11" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vacuas caedis habete manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:642" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 642</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operum vacuus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vacuas habuissem criminis umbras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:541" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 541</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">composuit ad Caesarem litteras, quasi confecto bello verbis magnificas, rerum vacuas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50071.12" n="(d)" level="5"> With <case>dat.</case> of that for which room or a vacancy exists or is made: <cit><quote lang="la">Aruns Tarquinius et Tullia minor, prope continuatis funeribus cum domos vacuas novo matrimonio fecissent, junguntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:46:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 46, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">necato filio vacuam domum scelestis nuptiis fecisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanto molimine circumspectemus vacuam Romanis vatibus aedem (Apollinis),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 94</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">văcŭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <cb n="VADI" /> <hi rend="ital">leisure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid invenire vacui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:6:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 6, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50071.13" n="II" level="1"> In partic. (cf. vaco, II.). </sense><sense id="n50071.14" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Free from labor</hi> or <hi rend="ital">occupation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without business</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at leisure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disengaged</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unoccupied</hi>, <hi rend="ital">idle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam vacui sumus, dicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:4:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si es animo vacuo, expone nobis quod quaerimus ... hunc elegimus diem, cum te sciremus esse vacuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:5:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 5, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus vacuus ac solutus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 9, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures vacuae atque eruditae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 41</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedibus vacuis terere Porticum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:491" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 491</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid vacui sub umbrā Lusimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:32:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 32, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cetera, quae vacuas tenuissent carmine mentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne vacuum esse me nunc ad narrandum credas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut animum vacuum ad res difficiles scribendas afferam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:38:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 38, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum per tot menses vacuā civitate nemo controversiam fecerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:40:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 40, 10</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec rursus jubeo, dum sit vacuissima quaeras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:1:141" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 1, 141</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, transf., of places in which to lounge or enjoy leisure, <hi rend="ital">quiet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">peaceful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undisturbed</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">Tibur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Athenae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tonsoris in umbrā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 7, 50</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">otiosa Neapolis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 5, 43</bibl></cit>).—Rarely of persons, <hi rend="ital">free from care</hi>, <hi rend="ital">calm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">composed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Rutilius animo vacuus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>careless</tr>, <tr>without apprehension</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 52:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 52, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud animi vacuus,</quote> <trans><tr>quiet</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:644" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 644</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cantamus vacui, sive quid urimur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 6, 19</bibl></cit>; so of one <hi rend="ital">free from love</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 5, 10</bibl>.—Of female animals, <hi rend="ital">not bearing young</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:37:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 37, 10</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: vacuum est, with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">there is leisure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">time</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 1, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 28</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50071.15" n="B" level="2"> Of time, <hi rend="ital">free</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vacant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disengaged</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leisure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">etiam si spatium ad dicendum nostro commodo vacuosque dies habuissemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:17:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 17, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum vacui temporis nihil haberem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 23, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vacuam noctem operi dedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:28:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 28, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:4:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50071.16" n="C" level="2"> Of women, <hi rend="ital">free</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unmarried</hi>, <hi rend="ital">single</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi mulier vacua fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 44</bibl></cit>: vacuis indicere nuptias, Pseudo - <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 376" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 376</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hersilia,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>widowed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:831" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 831</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50071.17" n="D" level="2"> Of possessions, <hi rend="ital">free</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vacant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without an occupant</hi> or <hi rend="ital">master</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vacuam possessionem regni sperans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prudentiae doctrinaeque possessio ... quasi caduca atque vacua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:31:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 31, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">centuria, id. Tull. § 17: sese praedia vacua filio traditurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 9, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vacuam rempublicam tradere Hannibali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut impetus fiat in vacuam rempublicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 52:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 52, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacerdotia ut vacua contulit in alios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 40</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Syriam provinciam vacuam tum morte Atilii Rufi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vacua Armenia,</quote> <trans><tr>without a ruler</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 12, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:9:1:section=12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 9, 1, § 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">possessio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:3:4:section=22" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 41, 3, 4, § 22</bibl></cit>; Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 4, 131</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">văcŭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis casus puerum egerit Orco, In vacuum venias,</quote> <trans><tr>into the vacant property</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut in vacuum lege praeditoriā venalis pependerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:9:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 9, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50071.18" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Without value</hi>, <hi rend="ital">worthless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">useless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">empty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unprofitable</hi>, = vanus (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not anteAug.): si respublica et senatus et populus vacua nomina sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vacua et inanis productio verbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:15:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 15, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tollens vacuum plus nimio Gloria verticem,</quote> <trans><tr>her empty head</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:18:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 18, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecunia,</quote> <trans><tr>unused</tr>, <tr>unproductive</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:5:24" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 5, 24</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:3:28" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 16, 3, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vada: <entryFree id="n50072" type="main" key="Vada1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vada</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n50072.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stronghold in</hi> Gallia Belgica, in the country of the Batavi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:20 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 20 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n50073" type="main" key="Va^da2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Văda</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n50073.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Liguria</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Savona</hi>, Brut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 10, 3</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called Vada Sabatia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 7, § 48</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n50074" type="main" key="Va^da3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Văda Volaterrana</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n50074.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a port in Etruria south of Pisa</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Torre di Vado</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 6, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 8, § 50</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vadimonis: <entryFree id="n50075" type="main" key="Va^di^mo_nis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vădĭmōnis lăcus</orth>, <sense id="n50075.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small lake in Etruria near Ameria</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Laghetto di Bassano</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 95, 96, § 209</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:39:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 39, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 20, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:25:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 25, 8</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">in the order lacus Vadimonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:13:11" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 13, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. Dennis, Etruria, 1, p. 107 sq.</sense></entryFree>
vadimonium: <entryFree id="n50076" type="main" key="va^di^mo_ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vădĭmōnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>1. vas</etym>; jurid. t. t., <sense id="n50076.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a promise secured by bail</hi> for appearance on a particular day before a tribunal, <hi rend="ital">bail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">security</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recognizance.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50076.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: cum autem in jus vocatus fuerit adversarius ni eo die finitum fuerit negotium, vadimonium ei faciendum est, id est, ut promittat, se certo <cb n="VADO" /> die sisti, Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 4, 184</bibl>;
