valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 137</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:509" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 509</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:300" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 300</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 228</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:291" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 291</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pontes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:285" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 285</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1440" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 1440</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tormenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:329" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 329</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bipennis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:331" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 331</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbs valida muris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 15, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">validiores munitiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:17:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 17, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:37" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesidia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">robustis apta materia validissima est,</quote> <trans><tr>the strongest</tr>, <tr>most nourishing food</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> (cf. valens, A.): <cit><quote lang="la">ptisanae usus validissimus saluberrimusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 7, 15, § 74</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pondus sustinere valida abies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:222" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 42, 81, § 222</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(canis) validus servare gregem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutrop. 1, 34</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50135.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n50135.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Well</hi> in body, <hi rend="ital">in good health</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">healthy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">salvus atque validus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jamne isti abierunt, Qui me vi cogunt, ut validus insaniam?</quote> <trans><tr>of sound body</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si, ut spero, te validum videro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">validus male filius,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>sickly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">necdum ex morbo satis validus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">color validus,</quote> <trans><tr>healthy complexion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 5, 20, § 42</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n50135.5" n="2" level="3"> Of medicines, <hi rend="ital">strong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">powerful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">active</hi>, <hi rend="ital">efficacious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:533" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 533</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 262</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sucus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:316" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 316</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venenum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:123" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 123</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">validissima faex aceti contra cerastas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 2, 32, § 67</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n50135.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">strong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mighty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">powerful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">effective</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jovi opulento, incluto ... valido viripotenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aevi leges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valida urbs et potens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fama validissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ducibus validiorem quam exercitu rem Romanam esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:39:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 39, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">delecti, quibus corpus annis infirmum, ingenium sapientiā validum erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mente minus validus quam corpore toto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam sit ingenio validus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:62" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opibus, ingenio validus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir gratiā et facundiā validus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:9:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 9, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tiberius spernendis rumoribus validus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctor validissimus mittendi secretos nuntios,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad Caesaris amicitiam validus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversus consentientis nec regem quemquam satis validum nec tyrannum fore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:49:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 49, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum validae tum breves vibrantesque sententiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:60" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">validissimum genus (dicendi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 10, 63</bibl></cit>. —With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">orandi validus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colonia virium et opum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aevi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 16" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—Hence, <hi rend="ital">advv.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50135.7" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">vălĭdē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">strongly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stoutly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vehemently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mightily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">powerfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exceedingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very</hi>, etc. (not in Cic. or Cæs.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut valide tonuit!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 5, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam valide tonuit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 1, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluctuat valide mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne tua vox valide valet!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 3, 3, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vostra latera loris faciam valide varia uti sint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amare valide coepi hinc meretricem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:prol. 42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. prol. 42</bibl></cit>; <pb n="1956" /> <cb n="VALL" /> 48.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">validius clamare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 16, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo me validius cruciaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6</bibl></cit>, praef. § <cit><quote lang="la">8: quanto validius bonos inhibet pudor quam metus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:76" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 2, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utros peccare validius putem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abrogant fidem validius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 2, 4, § 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëtae sunt molesti validius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4</bibl></cit>, epil. 9.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: validissime alicui favere, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 2, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:35:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 35, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 15, 2</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n50135.8" n="2" level="3"> As a reply in the affirmative, <hi rend="ital">certainly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by all means</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be sure: Ca.</hi> Legirupa. <hi rend="ital">Ba.</hi> Valide. <hi rend="ital">Ps.</hi> Pernicies adulescentum. <hi rend="ital">Ba.</hi> Acerrime, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 130</bibl>; cf. v. 110.—</sense><sense id="n50135.9" n="B" level="2"> In a contr. form, <orth extent="full" lang="la">valdē</orth>, an <hi rend="ital">intens. adv.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strongly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vehemently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">energetically</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vigorously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intensely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very much</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exceedingly</hi> (freq. and class.; cf.: graviter, multo, bene, magnopere, etc.). </sense><sense id="n50135.10" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">verbs</hi>: quidquid volt, valde volt, Caes. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc inhibere illud tuum, quod valde mihi arriserat, vehementer displicet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 21, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistula tua, quae me valde levavit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de Vergilii parte valde probo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 26, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui valde interdicere, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:39:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 39, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non valde moveri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hos sermones ... lacessivi numquam, sed non valde repressi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litteras tuas valde exspecto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille se profecisse sciat, cui Cicero valde placebit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:112" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 112</bibl></cit>.—Strengthened by <hi rend="ital">nimis</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu vero eum nec nimis valde umquam nec nimis saepe laudaveris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—By <hi rend="ital">tam</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc est in vitio, dissolutionem naturae tam valde perhorrescere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:11:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 11, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil mihi tam valde placeat, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem tam diu tamque valde timuissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de remedio non tam valde laboro,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 17</bibl></cit>.—By <hi rend="ital">quam</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vosmet videte, quam mihi valde placuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:prol. 103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. prol. 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam valde universi admurmuraverint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:16:section=41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 16, § 41</bibl></cit>: significare quam valde probetis ea, quae, etc., Caes. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 7</bibl>, C, 1.—</sense><sense id="n50135.11" n="(b)" level="5"> With adjectives: <cit><quote lang="la">magistratus valde lenes et remissi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:43:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 43, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetas valde longa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 37, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exspectatio valde magna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 17, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui me praeripere desponsam laudem, valde est iniquum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo et acutus, ut Poenus, et valde studiosus ac diligens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 31, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mala valde est Bestia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:69:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 69, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoties verbum verbo aut non dissimile valde quaeritur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:75" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 75</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">tam</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi vero quicquam sit tam valde, quam nihil sapere, vulgare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:39:81" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 39, 81</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">quam</hi>: nam suos valde quam paucos habet, Brut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 13, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50135.12" n="(g)" level="5"> With adverbs: insanum valde uterque deamat, Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 127, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">valde vehementer et libere dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud valde graviter tulerunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 17, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem valde bene gerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valde multum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 9, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50135.13" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi> (rare; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">valide, supra): novit me valdius ipso,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 9, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valdius oblectat populum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:321" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 321</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50135.14" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos valdissime diligunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 8:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Brev. Vit. 8, 4</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n50135.15" n="2" level="3"> As a strongly confirmative reply, <hi rend="ital">yes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">certainly: Ca.</hi> Meam tu amicam vendidisti? <hi rend="ital">Ba.</hi> Valde, viginti minis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 110</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vallaris: <entryFree id="n50136" type="main" key="valla_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vallāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vallum</etym>, <sense id="n50136.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a rampart</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corona,</quote> <trans><tr>given to him who first mounted the enemy's rampart</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:46:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 46, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:28:6" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 28, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 4, 3, § 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:6" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 3, 4, § 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vallatio: <entryFree id="n50137" type="main" key="valla_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vallātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vallo</etym>, <sense id="n50137.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an intrenchment</hi> (late Lat.), only trop.: <cit><quote lang="la">medicorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 4, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
valles: <entryFree id="n50138" type="main" key="valles"><orth extent="full" lang="la">valles</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">vallis</orth> (the former, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:522" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 522</bibl>; <sense id="n50138.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">the latter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 155</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">8, 334 al.</bibl>; cf. Fest. s. v. convallis, p. 42 Müll.), <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e(/los</foreign>, lowland, <foreign lang="greek">*)=hlis</foreign>; Lat. Veliae, Velitrae</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a valley</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vale.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50138.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod satis magna valles intercedebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicus positus in valle,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per supinam vallem fusi sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:46:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 46, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supinā valle praecipites egistis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:24:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 24, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">continui montes, nisi dissocientur opacā Valle,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in reductā valle,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:17:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 17, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:703" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 703</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (colles) afferunt umbram vallibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:6:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valles cavae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:391" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 391</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxosas inter decurrunt flumina valles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 5, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est curvo anfractu valles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:522" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 11, 522</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rivos de pronā praeceps est valle volutus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus est imis in vallibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:761" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 761</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub opacā valle,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:277" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 277</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cb n="VALL" /> (eloquentia) ut latissimi amnes totis vallibus fluat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 14, 31</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50138.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vallis plorationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 9:2" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:83:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 83, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50138.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, transf., <hi rend="ital">a hollow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">valle sub alarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:69:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 69, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">femorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 128, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vallescit: <entryFree id="n50139" type="gloss" key="vallescit"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vallescit</orth> <itype>perierit, dictum a vallo militari, quod fit circa castra, quod qui eo eiciuntur pro perditis habentur</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=377" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 377</bibl> Müll. (where Lachm. reads vallessit; cf.: valle feci, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 217, 24</bibl>; v. Lachm. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2, p. 191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, p. 191</bibl>).</entryFree>
vallestria: <entryFree id="n50140" type="main" key="vallestri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vallestrĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>vallis</etym>, <sense id="n50140.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">valleys</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vales</hi>, Ambros. Hexaëm. 3, 3, 14 al.</sense></entryFree>
vallicula: <entryFree id="n50141" type="main" key="valli^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vallĭcŭla</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">vallĕcŭla</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 11, 522</bibl>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>valles</etym>, <sense id="n50141.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little valley</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a glen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dell</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vallis deminutivum vallicula facit, Fest. s. v. convallis, p. 42 Müll.: deformes,</quote> <trans><tr>little hollows</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:14:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 14, 37</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vallis: <entryFree id="n50142" type="main" key="vallis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vallis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, v. valles.</entryFree>
vallo: <entryFree id="n50143" type="main" key="vallo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vallo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>vallum</etym>, in milit. lang., <sense id="n50143.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to surround with a rampart and palisades</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to palisade</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intrench</hi>, <hi rend="ital">circumvallate</hi> (syn. saepio). </sense><sense id="n50143.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra vallantem Fabium adorti sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:41:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 41, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra vallari placuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 19</bibl></cit>; so, castra, Auct. B. Alex. 27, 6; 30, 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 18, 20, § 76</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vallare noctem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to intrench themselves at night</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulli vallārant oppida muri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 224</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">muniendo vallandoque militem firmabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50143.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to fortify</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defend</hi> with something: <cit><quote lang="la">elephantis aciem utrimque vallaverat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:8" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Macedoniam suam armis ferroque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:12:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pontus et regiis opibus et ipsā naturā regionis vallatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 9, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbs Capsa in mediā Africā sita anguibus arenisque vallata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:1:14" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum gladio te vallare scieris, vallum ferre desinito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Epit. 57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> Epit. 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vallatus bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">videbant Catilinam ... vallatum indicibus atque sicariis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:24:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 24, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec omnia quasi saepimento aliquo vallabit disserendi ratione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:24:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 24, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus legatorum divino jure esse vallatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:16:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 16, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignotae cumulis vallatus harenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:16" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 16</bibl></cit> (4, 15), 29: <cit><quote lang="la">templa praesenti numine vallata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:11" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 11</bibl></cit>, ext. 4: <cit><quote lang="la">hydra venenatis vallata colubris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 27</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:697" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 697</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 1932" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 1932</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:407" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 407</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sol radiis frontem vallatus acutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 4, 159</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vallantur planctibus arae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:564" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 564</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">To surround</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">abyssus vallavit me,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Jonae, 2, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vallonia: <entryFree id="n50144" type="main" key="Vallo_ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vallōnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n50144.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the goddess of valleys</hi>: collibus deam Collatinam, vallibus Valloniam praefecerunt, Aug. Civ. Dei, 4, 8.</sense></entryFree>
vallum: <entryFree id="n50145" type="main" key="vallum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vallum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>collective of 1. vallus; the line of palisades about an intrenchment; hence</etym>, <sense id="n50145.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an earthen wall</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rampart set with palisades</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a palisaded rampart</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intrenchment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">circumvallation.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50145.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=117" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 117</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:5:4 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 5, 4 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra vallo fossāque munire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem vallo et fossā saeptum tenere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppidum vallo et fossā cingere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 20, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppidum vallo et fossā circumdare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 4, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 76:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 76, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:23:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 23, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 146</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 506</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 524</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:9:13 al" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 9, 13 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n50145.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">a wall</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rampart</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fortification;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non Alpium vallum contra ascensum transgressionemque Gallorum obicio et oppono,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:33:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 33, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">India vallo munitur eburno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:538" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 538</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepes pastorum munita vallo arboris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 5, 11, § 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(spica) contra avium minorum morsus munitur vallo aristarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:15:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 15, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munitae sunt palpebrae tamquam vallo pilorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:57:143" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 57, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 1, p. 10, 9</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">si interdicta petes vallo (i. e. stola) circumdata, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 96</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vallus: <entryFree id="n50146" type="main" key="vallus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vallus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">h(=los</foreign>, nail</etym>, <sense id="n50146.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pale.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50146.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (rare). </sense><sense id="n50146.2" n="a" level="4"> For supporting vines, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:264" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 264</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 25</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50146.3" n="b" level="4"> A pole set with teeth and fastened to a cart, pushed forwards by oxen placed behind; <cit><quote lang="la">used by the Gauls for cutting grain,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:296" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 30, 72, § 296</bibl></cit> (in <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 7, 2</bibl>, called vehiculum).—</sense><sense id="n50146.4" n="II" level="1"> Esp., in milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">a stake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">palisade</hi>, used for intrenchment (freq. and class.): qui labor, quantus agminis; <cit><quote lang="la">ferre plus dimidiati mensis cibaria ... ferre vallum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:16:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 16, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Scipio Africanus militem cottidie in opere habuit et triginta dierum frumentum, ad septenos vallos ferre cogebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Epit. 57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> Epit. 57</bibl></cit>: virgulta<cb n="VANI" />  vallo caedendo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:36:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 36, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vallum cae dere et parare jubet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vallum secum ferente milite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo qui intraverant, se ipsi acutissimis vallis induebant: hos cippos appellabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 73</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50146.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50146.6" n="1" level="3"> Collect. for vallum, <hi rend="ital">a rampart set with palisades</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 63</bibl>; Auct. B. Alex. 2, 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:10:9" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 10, 9</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n50146.7" n="2" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a point</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spike</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectinis,</quote> <trans><tr>a tooth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:14:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 14, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n50147" type="main" key="vallus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vallus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>contr. for vannulus, from vannus</etym>, <sense id="n50147.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little winnowing-van</hi> for grain or provender, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:52:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 52, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:1:23:5" default="NO">1, 23, 5</bibl>; id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. G. 1, 166</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
valor: <entryFree id="n50148" type="main" key="va^lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vălor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>valeo</etym>, <sense id="n50148.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">value</hi>: valor, <foreign lang="greek">timh/</foreign>, Gloss. Lab.</sense></entryFree>
valva: <entryFree id="n50149" type="main" key="valva"><orth extent="full" lang="la">valva</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n50149.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the leaf of a door</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a folding-door; sing.</hi> rare, Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 19, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 96</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 999" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 999</bibl>.—Mostly <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">valvae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <hi rend="ital">the leaves</hi>, <hi rend="ital">folds</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">valves of a door</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a folding-door</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:34:74" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 34, 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:43:section=94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 43, § 94</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 56, § 124</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 105</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:63" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 8, 51; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 172</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 112</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:17:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 17, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 6, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:6:38" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 6, 38</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
valvatus: <entryFree id="n50150" type="main" key="valva_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">valvātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>valvae</etym>, <sense id="n50150.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having folding-doors</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">valvata et fenestrata triclinia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:section=29" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, § 29</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">lumina fenestrarum (in tricliniis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
valvolae: <entryFree id="n50151" type="main" key="valvo^lae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">valvŏlae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym> (quasi double-flaps, i. e.), <sense id="n50151.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the pod</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pericarp</hi>, <hi rend="ital">valvules</hi> of leguminous plants: <cit><quote lang="la">fabarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:17:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 17, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:10:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 10, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:4:3" default="NO">6, 4, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:4:2" default="NO">7, 4, 2</bibl> (ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=375" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 375</bibl> Müll. <hi rend="ital">masc.</hi> valvoli).</sense></entryFree>
vandalii: <entryFree id="n50152" type="main" key="Vanda^li^i"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vandălĭi</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vandĭli</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vandĭlĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50152.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Vandals</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a people in the northern part of Germany in the time of Tacitus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 2</bibl> (Vandalii, Halm; Vandilii, Ritter); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 14, 28, § 99</bibl> (Vandili, Jan. and Sillig). —<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vandalus,</quote> <trans><tr>a Vandal</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 2, 369</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n50152.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vandălus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Vandal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 2, 348</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50152.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vandălĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a surname of Justinian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as conqueror of the Vandals</hi>, Jornand. R. Get. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
vane: <entryFree id="n50153" type="main" key="va_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vānē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. vanus <sense id="n50153.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
vanesco: <entryFree id="n50154" type="main" key="va_nesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vānesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n50154.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [vanus], <hi rend="ital">to pass away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disappear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vanish</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose). </sense><sense id="n50154.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">incipiunt gravidae vanescere nubes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:2:107" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 2, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ceres in sterilem herbam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:7:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 7, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spiritus meus in auras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 12, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuncta in cinerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nigra sed infusā vancscat sepia lymphā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:13" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(nubes) pondere suo victa in latitudinem vanescebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 16, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50154.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vanescitque absens et novus intrat amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:358" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 358</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inanis credulitas tempore ipso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 40</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tempore ac spatio vanescere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ira plebis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicta per auras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:14:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 14, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos nolite pati nostrum vanescere luctum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to be in vain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 199</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cavendum est ne ipsa expositio vanescat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:3:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod magnificum alio referente fuisset, ipso qui gesserat recensente vanescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:8:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 8, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vanga: <entryFree id="n50155" type="main" key="vanga"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vanga</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n50155.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of mattock</hi>, or, acc. to others, <hi rend="ital">a spade with a cross-bar to put the foot upon</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 43, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vangio: <entryFree id="n50156" type="main" key="Vangi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vangĭo</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50156.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a prince of the Suevi</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:99 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 99 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
vangiones: <entryFree id="n50157" type="main" key="Vangi^o^nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vangĭŏnes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n50157.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a German people on the Rhine</hi>, about the mod. <hi rend="ital">Worms</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 17, 31, § 106</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 12, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:431" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 431</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 11, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50157.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the capital of the Vangiones</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Worms</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 11, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vanidicus: <entryFree id="n50158" type="main" key="va_ni^di^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vānĭdĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vanus-dico</etym>, <sense id="n50158.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">vain - speaking; false - speaking; subst.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a liar</hi> (ante- and post-class. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">cum probis potius quam cum improbis vivere vanidicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 1, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 7, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vanienses: <entryFree id="n50159" type="main" key="Va_ni^enses"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vānĭenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50159.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of</hi> Gallia Transalpina, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 19, 23, § 130</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vaniloquentia: <entryFree id="n50160" type="main" key="va_ni^lo^quenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vānĭlŏquentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vaniloquus</etym>, <sense id="n50160.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">empty</hi> or <hi rend="ital">idle talk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vaunting</hi> (rarely; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hac vaniloquentiā primum Aristaenum praetorem Achaeorum excitavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:24:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 24, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 49</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 31</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Rer. Gest. Alex. 2:10" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Rer. Gest. Alex. 2, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vaniloquidorus: <entryFree id="n50161" type="main" key="Va_ni^lo^qui^do_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vānĭlŏquĭdōrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>vanus-loquor. <foreign lang="greek">dw=ron</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n50161.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gabble-giver</hi>, a facetiously-formed name of a liar, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 6, 20</bibl>. <pb n="1957" /> <cb n="VANU" /></sense></entryFree>
vaniloquium: <entryFree id="n50162" type="main" key="va_ni^lo^qui^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vānĭlŏquĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>vaniloquus</etym>, <sense id="n50162.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">empty</hi> or <hi rend="ital">idle talk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gabble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vaunting</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">seductionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 134:4" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 134, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:166:6" default="NO">166, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vaniloquus: <entryFree id="n50163" type="main" key="va_ni^lo^quus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vānĭlŏquus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-lŏcus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vanus-loquor</etym>, <sense id="n50163.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">talking emplily</hi> or <hi rend="ital">idly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gabbling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prating</hi>, i. e., </sense><sense id="n50163.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Lying</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia vanilocu's, vapulabis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 223</bibl></cit>.— <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 63, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50163.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Boastful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bragging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vaunting</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:48:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 48, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:280" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 280</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vanitas: <entryFree id="n50164" type="main" key="va_ni^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vānĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vanus</etym>. <sense id="n50164.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">emptiness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nothingness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nullity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">want of reality</hi>: nulla in caelo nec fortuna, nec temeritas, nec erratio, nec vanitas inest; <cit><quote lang="la">contra omnis ordo, veritas, ratio, constantia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:21:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 21, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne vanitas itineris ludibrio esset,</quote> <trans><tr>uselessness</tr>, <tr>purposelessness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:22:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 22, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romanis Gallici tumultus adsueti, etiam vanitates notae sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:17:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 17, 5</bibl></cit> Weissenb. —</sense><sense id="n50164.1" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">falsity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">falsehood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deception</hi>, <hi rend="ital">untruth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">untrustworthiness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fickleness</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n50164.2" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">non pudet Vanitatis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 3, 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imbuimur erroribus, ut vanitati veritas cedat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mercatura ... multa undique apportans, multisque sine vanitate impertiens, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:42:151" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 42, 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec vero quicquam turpius est vanitate,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 42, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamvis blanda ista vanitas apud eos valeat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:26:99" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 26, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ad vanitatem accessit auctoritas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 25, 94</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Magicae vanitates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 4, 9, § 18</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 8, 35, § 57</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n50164.3" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid de iis existimandum est, qui orationis vanitatem adhibuerunt?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:14:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 14, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opinionum vanitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:10:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 10, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suum imperium minui per vanitatem populi,</quote> <trans><tr>fickleness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:22:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 22, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa circa hoc non Magorum solum vanitate, sed etiam Pythagoricorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 8, 9, § 20</bibl></cit> Jan.—</sense><sense id="n50164.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">vanity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vainglory</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic homini non minor vanitas inerat quam audacia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 23, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 38:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 38, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui se propalam per vanitatem jactassent tamquam amicos Persei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:31:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 31, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vanitas atque jactatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vanitas atque insolentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quintius Atticus consul umbrā honoris et suāmet vanilate monstratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec Agricola prosperitate rerum in vanitatem usus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Statius veniam ... vanitate exitūs corrupit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 15, 71</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vanities: <entryFree id="n50165" type="main" key="va_ni^ti^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vānĭtĭes</orth>, ēï, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50165.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">emptiness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nullity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">folly</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">plebeia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 1, 13</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n50165.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">vanity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vainglory</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad extollendam ejus vanitiem sidera quoque, si jussisset, exhiberi posse promittens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 1, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vanitudo: <entryFree id="n50166" type="main" key="va_ni^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vānĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50166.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">emptiness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nothingness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vainglory</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vanity</hi> (ante-class.): ne turpasse vanitudine aetatem suam, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 184, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vera vanitudine convincere,</quote> <trans><tr>by empty</tr>, <tr>lying talk</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 37</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vannius: <entryFree id="n50167" type="main" key="Vanni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vannĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50167.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a king of the Quadi in the time of Tiberius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 63</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 29</bibl> sq.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vannĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">of Vannius</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">regnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 25, § 81</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vanno: <entryFree id="n50168" type="main" key="vanno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vanno</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>vannus</etym>, <sense id="n50168.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fan</hi>, <hi rend="ital">winnow</hi> (ante-class.): frumentum, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 19, 25</bibl> and 27.</sense></entryFree>
vannus: <entryFree id="n50169" type="main" key="vannus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vannus</orth>, <itype>i</itype> (<sense id="n50169.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. heterocl.</hi> vannu, <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 19, 21</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a fan</hi>, <hi rend="ital">van</hi> for winnowing grain, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:20:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 20, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 260, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11</bibl>, p. 269, 2: <cit><quote lang="la">mystica Iacchi,</quote> <trans><tr>borne about in the Bacchic festival</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 166</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vano: <entryFree id="n50170" type="main" key="va_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vāno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>vanus</etym>, <sense id="n50170.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to utter empty words</hi>, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 16, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">184, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vanus: <entryFree id="n50171" type="main" key="va_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>etym. dub.; cf. vaco</etym>, <sense id="n50171.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that contains nothing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">empty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">void. vacant.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50171.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): sed illos Exspectata seges vanis elusit aristis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 226</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leve ac vanum granum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:9:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 9, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne vana urbis magnitudo esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 8, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vanior jam erat hostium acies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:47:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 47, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">videtis ordines raros, cornua extenta, mediam aciem vanam et exhaustam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:14:14" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 14, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vanam aciem esse ratus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>thin</tr>, <tr>weak</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:14:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 14, 8</bibl></cit>: non vanae redeat sanguis imagini, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to the shade of the dead</hi> (so called as being without a body), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:24:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 24, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 27, 41</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50171.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">empty</hi> as to purport or result, <hi rend="ital">idle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">null</hi>, <hi rend="ital">groundless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unmeaning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fruitless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vain</hi> (freq. and class.): omnes dant consilium vanum, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. 2:13" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. 2, 13</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 419 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">falsum aut vanum aut fictum (opp. vera),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:26:98" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 26, 98</bibl></cit>: vana quaedam atque inania polliceri. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:42:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 42, 101</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vana falsaque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 2, 5</bibl></cit>, <cb n="VAPO" /> § <cit><quote lang="la">14: res tumida, vana, ventosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 84:11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 84, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationi vanae crediderunt,</quote> <trans><tr>idle</tr>, <tr>delusive</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:40:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 40, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non bellum sed vanam imaginem belli insedisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 16, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:263" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 263</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convicia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:303" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 303</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">historiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:8:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 8, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argumentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 2, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">error,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1068" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 1068</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agitatio armorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 10, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">metus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 23, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:342" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 342</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gaudia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 188</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:364" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 364</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ira,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:374" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 8, 374</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 10, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:597" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 597</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox auguris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:349" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 349</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuspis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:346" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 346</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pila omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:23:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 23, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pleraque tela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:10:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 10, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ensis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:10:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 10, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:39:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 39, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">promissa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vana et irrita testamenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vaniore dicendi genere inflata (gens),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiarum vanissimus strepitus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 1</bibl></cit>.—With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam equestris pugna effectu quam conatibus vanior erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 7, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio non suis vana laudibus, non crimine alieno laeta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:41:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 41, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50171.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vānum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">emptiness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nothingness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">naught</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad vanum et irritum redacta victoria,</quote> <trans><tr>brought to nothing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:37:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 37, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec tota ex vano criminatio erat,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>groundless</tr>, <tr>without cause</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:31:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 31, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex vano habere spem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 26, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cedit labor in vanum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 182" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 182</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud vana adtulere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:37:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 37, 6</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Neutr. plur. adverb.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut vidit (Arruntem) laetantem animis ac vana tumentem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>vainly</tr>, <tr>with vain show</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:854" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 854</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corruptus vanis rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vana rumoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 59</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50171.4" n="3" level="3"> Vanum est, with <hi rend="ital">subject-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vanum arbitror esse circa canis ortum angues candidos membranam eam exuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 3, 8, § 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50171.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of persons, <hi rend="ital">false</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deceptive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delusive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">untrustworthy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vanus et perfidiosus et impius,</quote> <trans><tr>false</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 6, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vanus mendaxque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haruspices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:19:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 19, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec mihi non vani (neque erat cur fallere vellent) Narravere senes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>veracious</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:721" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 721</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium dictatoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:27:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 27, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vane Ligus frustraque animis elate superbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:715" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 715</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir omnium vanissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:30:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 30, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidia vulgi vanum ingenium dictatoris corrupit,</quote> <trans><tr>weak</tr>, <tr>wavering</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:27:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 27, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne irrisus ac vanus iisdem castris assideret, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>in vain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut ego (i. e. Juno) veri Vana feror,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:631" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 631</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voti vanus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>deceived</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:261" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 261</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turba vana sanctitudinis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. p. 43, 1</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n50171.6" n="2" level="3"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">vainglorious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ostentatious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">boastful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cn. Lentulus perincertum stolidior an vanior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 4:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 4, 35</bibl></cit> Dietsch ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">laudare se vani, vituperare stulti est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 2</bibl></cit>, ext. 8.—With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc ingenio vanum Aetoli inpulerant in spem regni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:47:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 47, 7</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vānē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">idly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vainly</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">vane gaudere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vanius excogitatum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 300, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecavere vanissime,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pud. 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vapide: <entryFree id="n50172" type="main" key="va^pi^de_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">văpĭdē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. vapidus <sense id="n50172.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
vapidus: <entryFree id="n50173" type="main" key="va^pi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">văpĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vapor</etym>, <sense id="n50173.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that has emitted steam</hi> or <hi rend="ital">vapor</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">that has lost its life and spirit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spoiled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vapid.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50173.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:5:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 5, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50173.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">spoiled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bad.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50173.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:148" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 148</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50173.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">astutam vapido servas sub pectore vulpem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:117" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 117</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">văpĭdē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">poorly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">badly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ill</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">se habere, for male se habere, a favorite expression of Augustus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:87" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 87</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vapor: <entryFree id="n50174" type="main" key="va^por"><orth extent="full" lang="la">văpor</orth> (ante-class. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">văpos</orth>, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 487, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:952" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 952</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 13</bibl>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. kapis, incense; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">kapu/w, kapno/s</foreign>, smoke; cf. vappa</etym>, <sense id="n50174.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">steam</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exhalation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vapor</hi> (syn. exhalatio). </sense><sense id="n50174.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">aquarum vapores, qui a sole ex agris tepefactis et ex aquis excitantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:46:118" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 46, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquarum quasi vapor quidam aër habendus est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 10, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:271" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 271</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae calidae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 7, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 20" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrenus vapor siccus est et fumo similis, qui ventos, tonitrua et fulmina facit: aquarum halitus umidus est et imbres et nives creat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:12:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nocturnos formidare vapores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 93</bibl></cit>: volat vapor ater ad auras. <hi rend="ital">smoke</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:466" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 466</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:5:40" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 5, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:110" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 110</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 911" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc.
