Fur. 911</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50174.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a warm exhalation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">warmth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heat</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n50174.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(terra semen) tepefactum vapore et compressu suo diffundit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:15:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 15, 51</bibl></cit>: aestifer ignis uti lumen jacit atque vaporem, <cb n="VAPU" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:663" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 663</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">solis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1032" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 1032</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:150" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 150</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:185" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 185</bibl>; 4, 201; 6, 236; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:5:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 5, 3</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the heat of the thunderbolt: inusta vaporis signa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 220</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">finditque vaporibus arva (Phoebus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">siderum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:3:15" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lentusque carinas Est vapor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:683" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 683</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 698</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus torridus et vaporis plenus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:48:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 48, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vapore foveri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 7, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 7, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 9</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 8, 4; 8, 7; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:4:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 4, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3:8 al" default="NO">7, 3, 8 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n50174.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">warmth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ardor</hi> of love: <cit><quote lang="la">pectus insanum vapor amorque torret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 640" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 640</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vaporalis: <entryFree id="n50175" type="main" key="va^po_ra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">văpōrālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vapor</etym>, <sense id="n50175.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to steam</hi> or <hi rend="ital">vapor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vapory</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">tenuitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Genes. ad Lit. 2:5" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Genes. ad Lit. 2, 5</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">văpōrālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">like a vapor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Genes. ad Lit. 2:4" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Genes. ad Lit. 2, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:3:10" default="NO">3, 10</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
vaporarium: <entryFree id="n50176" type="main" key="va^po_ra_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">văpōrārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50176.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a steam-pipe</hi> in the Roman baths, which conveyed the heat to the sweating-room, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:1:section=2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 1, § 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:24:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 24, 3</bibl> Haase.</sense></entryFree>
vaporate: <entryFree id="n50177" type="main" key="va^po_ra_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">văpōrātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>vaporatus</etym>, <sense id="n50177.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with heat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hotly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 24, 4, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vaporatio: <entryFree id="n50178" type="main" key="va^po_ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">văpōrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vaporo</etym>, <sense id="n50178.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a steaming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reeking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">steam</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vapor</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">inundantium aquarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 6:11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urinae impubium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 6, 18, § 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">balinearum,</quote> <trans><tr>a steam-bath</tr>, <tr>vapor-bath</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 4, 14, § 55</bibl></cit>.—Esp., <hi rend="ital">a fomentation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:17:171 al" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 17, 171 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
vaporifer: <entryFree id="n50179" type="main" key="va^po_ri^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">văpōrĭfer</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vapor-fero</etym>, <sense id="n50179.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">emitting steam</hi>, <hi rend="ital">full of vapors</hi> or <hi rend="ital">exhalations</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vaporous</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">fornaces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:3:45" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 3, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Baiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 5, 96</bibl></cit>: specus, Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:57" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 57</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vaporo: <entryFree id="n50180" type="main" key="va^po_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">văpōro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n50180.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [vapor] </sense><sense id="n50180.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to emit steam</hi> or <hi rend="ital">vapor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to steam</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reek.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50180.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae vaporant et in mari ipso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 2, 2, § 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae fontanae vaporantes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 21</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n50180.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to glow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burn</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidiā quoniam, ceu fulmine, summa vaporant Plerumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1132</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n50180.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fill with steam</hi> or <hi rend="ital">vapor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to steam</hi>, <hi rend="ital">smoke</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fumigate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">warm</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vaporatae nebulae (opp. frigidae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:5:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: nebula est exhalatio vaporata, <hi rend="ital">filled with vapor</hi>, App. de Mundo, p. 61, 6: <cit><quote lang="la">templum ture vaporant,</quote> <trans><tr>fumigate</tr>, <tr>perfume</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:481" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 481</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:455" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 455</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vaporato caespite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:2:62" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 2, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cantharides suspenduntur super acetum fervens, donec per linteolum vaporentur,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>are suffocated by the fumes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 4, 30, § 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">glebae solibus aestivis vaporatae,</quote> <trans><tr>warmed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:15:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 15, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">laevum decedens (sol) curru fugiente vaporet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum coquuntur carnes oculos vaporari his praecipiunt,</quote> <trans><tr>to be steamed</tr>, <tr>to receive the vapor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 11, 47, § 170</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos spongiis expressis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 20" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 20</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">morbi, quos vaporari oportet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 11, 47, § 128</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">inde vaporata lector mihi ferveat aure,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:126" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 126</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vaporosus: <entryFree id="n50181" type="main" key="va^po_ro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">văpōrōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50181.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of steam</hi> or <hi rend="ital">vapor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">steaming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vaporous</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">caligo, App M. 9, p. 222, 31: fontes balnearum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:ib. 5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5</bibl></cit>, p. 165, 24.</sense></entryFree>
vaporus: <entryFree id="n50182" type="main" key="va^po_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">văpōrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50182.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">steaming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reeking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">smoking</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">tus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Nemes.</author> Ecl. 4, 63</bibl></cit>: ardor, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 6, 115.</sense></entryFree>
vappa: <entryFree id="n50183" type="main" key="vappa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vappa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>kindr. with vapor; cf. vapidus</etym>, <sense id="n50183.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wine that has lost its spirit and flavor; palled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vapid wine.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50183.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitium musto quibusdam in locis iterum sponte fervere, quā calamitate deperit sapor vappaeque accipit nomen, probrosum etiam hominum, cum degeneravit animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 20, 25, § 125</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 144</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 5, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:48:14" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 48, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50183.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">masc.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a spoiled</hi> or <hi rend="ital">worthless fellow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a good-fornothing</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:28:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 28, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 104</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 2, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 14</bibl>; cf. Plin. l. l. supra.</sense></entryFree>
vappo: <entryFree id="n50184" type="main" key="vappo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vappo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>root vap-, to flutter; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">h/pi/olos</foreign>, moth</etym>, <sense id="n50184.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a moth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">butterfly</hi>, Lucr. (or Lucil.) Fragm. ap. Prob. p. 1450 P. (v. Lindem. Corp. Gram. I. p. 109, n. 32; cf. Lachm. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2, p. 165 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, p. 165 sq.</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
vapularis: <entryFree id="n50185" type="hapax" key="va_pu^la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vāpŭlāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vapulo</etym>, <sense id="n50185.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that gets a flogging</hi>: tribunus, facetiously, qs. <hi rend="ital">the head floggee</hi>, of a slave, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 1, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vapulo: <entryFree id="n50186" type="main" key="va_pu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vāpŭlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <sense id="n50186.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. neutral pass.</hi> [perh. root vap-; cf. vappo; prop. to wriggle, flutter; hence], <hi rend="ital">to get a cudgelling</hi> or <hi rend="ital">flogging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be flogged.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50186.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego vapulando, ille verberando usque ambo defessi sumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so (opp. verberare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 178</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vapulo ego invitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:5:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 5, 3, 15</bibl></cit>: ergo istoc magis, Quia vaniloquus, vapulabis,<pb n="1958" /> <cb n="VARI" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 1, 223</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum corpus vapulet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:936" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 936</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ego, sed tenuis vapulat umbra mea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 3</bibl></cit> (2, 12), 20: <cit><quote lang="la">qui illum viderant ab illo flagris vapulantem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Lud. Mort. Claud. 15:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Lud. Mort. Claud. 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testis in reum rogatus, an ab reo fustibus vapulasset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:3:16" default="NO">1, 3, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe territus quasi vapulaturus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:10:15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 10, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coctum ego, non vapulatum dudum conductus fui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 3, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50186.2" n="2" level="3"> Vapula, vapulet, as an opprobrious expression, <hi rend="ital">you be flogged! he be flogged!</hi> like the vulg. Engl., <hi rend="ital">you be hanged! he be hanged!</hi> nunc profecto vapula ob mendacium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 214</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 2, 4, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:5:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 5, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vapulet! Ne sibi me credat supplicem fore!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 2, 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vapulare te vehementer jubeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 4, 4, 12</bibl></cit>.—Hence, prov.: vapula Papiria, of doubtful signif.; v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=372" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 372</bibl> Müll. —</sense><sense id="n50186.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50186.4" n="1" level="3"> Of troops, like our <hi rend="ital">to be beaten</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to be conquered</hi>: septimam legionem vapulasse, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 1, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50186.5" n="2" level="3"> Of property, <hi rend="ital">to be dissipated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">squandered</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vapulat peculium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 6:7:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 6, 7, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50186.6" n="3" level="3"> In gen., of inanim. things, <hi rend="ital">to be struck</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beaten</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(olea) quae vapulavit macescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:55:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 55, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turris pluvio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 93" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agam. 93</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50186.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to be lashed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attacked</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium sermonibus vapulare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 14, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50186.8" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To be in trouble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be afflicted</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub Veneris regno vapulo, non sub Jovis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vara: <entryFree id="n50187" type="main" key="va_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vāra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n50187.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A wooden horse</hi> or <hi rend="ital">trestle</hi> for spreading nets upon; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, prov.: sequitur varam vibia,</quote> <trans><tr>one evil follows the other</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 12 praef.</bibl></cit> monos.—</sense><sense id="n50187.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A forked pole</hi> for spreading nets upon, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:439" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 439</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">to support a bough,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:9:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 9, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
varatio: <entryFree id="n50188" type="main" key="va_ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vārātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>varo</etym>, <sense id="n50188.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bending</hi>, <hi rend="ital">winding</hi> (late Lat.): fluminis, Auct. Limit. pp. 257 and 285 Goes.</sense></entryFree>
varciani: <entryFree id="n50189" type="main" key="Varcia_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Varciāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50189.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Pannonia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 25, 28, § 148</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vardaei: <entryFree id="n50190" type="main" key="Vardaei"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vardaei</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50190.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people in Dalmatia</hi>, Vatin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 9, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 22, 26, § 143</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
varduli: <entryFree id="n50191" type="main" key="Vardu^li"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vardŭli</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50191.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Lusitania</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:10:7" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 10, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:110" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 20, 34, § 110</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
varenus: <entryFree id="n50192" type="main" key="Va^re_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vărēnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50192.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman proper name</hi>, esp. L. Varenus, <hi rend="ital">who was defended by Cicero</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but convicted of assassination</hi>, Cic. Fragm. pro Var. 14, p. 5 B. and K.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:20:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 20, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vargula: <entryFree id="n50193" type="main" key="Vargu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vargŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50193.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a talkative friend of</hi> C. Julius Cæsar Strabo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:60:244" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 60, 244</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 60, 247</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vargunteius: <entryFree id="n50194" type="main" key="Vargunte_ius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Varguntēius</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, L., <sense id="n50194.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman senator who was engaged in Catiline's conspiracy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 17, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:28:1" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:47:1" default="NO" valid="yes">47, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vargus: <entryFree id="n50195" type="main" key="vargus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vargus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Gallic</etym>, <sense id="n50195.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a vagabond</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Eum.</author> Pan. Const. 9, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 6, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
varia: <entryFree id="n50196" type="main" key="va^ria1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">văria</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. varius, I. A. 2.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n50197" type="main" key="Va^ri^a2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vărĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n50197.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A small city of the Sabines</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Vicovaro</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5, prol. 14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, prol. 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50197.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town in Appulia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 11, 16, § 100</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
variabilis: <entryFree id="n50198" type="main" key="va^ri^a_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vărĭābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vario</etym>, <sense id="n50198.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">changeable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">variable</hi> (post-class.): aër, App. de Mundo, p. 58, 31.</sense></entryFree>
variantia: <entryFree id="n50199" type="main" key="va^ri^anti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vărĭantĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50199.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a difference</hi>, <hi rend="ital">diversity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">variety</hi> (Lucretian; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">varietas, vicissitudo): rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:653" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 653</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:318" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 318</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
varianus: <entryFree id="n50200" type="main" key="va^ri^a_nus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vărĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>varius</etym>, <sense id="n50200.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">divers-colored</hi>, <hi rend="ital">variegated</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">uvae, a particular kind so called,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 2, 4, § 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n50201" type="main" key="Va_ri^a_nus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vārĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 3. Varus.</entryFree>
variatim: <entryFree id="n50202" type="main" key="va^ri^a_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vărĭātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>vario</etym>, <sense id="n50202.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in various ways</hi>, <hi rend="ital">variously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:12:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 12, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:4:1:section=120" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 4, 1, § 120</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
variatio: <entryFree id="n50203" type="hapax" key="va^ri^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vărĭātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50203.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a difference</hi>, <hi rend="ital">variation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine variatione ullà,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 9, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
variatus: <entryFree id="n50204" type="main" key="va^ri^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vărĭātus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um. <sense id="n50204.0" n="I" level="1"> <mood>Part.</mood> of vario.— </sense><sense id="n50204.1" n="II" level="1"> <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">diverse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manifold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">varied</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lyra concentu variatior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 357 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
varicator: <entryFree id="n50205" type="main" key="va_ri^ca_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vārĭcātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>varico</etym>, <sense id="n50205.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one that walks with his legs spread apart</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a straddler</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praevaricator est quasi varicator, qui diversam partem adjuvat, proditā causā suā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:2:4:section=4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 2, 4, § 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:15:1" default="NO">47, 15, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
varico: <entryFree id="n50206" type="main" key="va_ri^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vārĭco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>1. varicus</etym>, <sense id="n50206.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to spread the legs apart</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to straddle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">varicare supra modum et in stando deforme est et accedente motu prope obscenum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:125" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 125</bibl></cit>: vallum, quod eā varicare nemo potest,<cb n="VARI" />  i. e. <hi rend="ital">can stride over it</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=117" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 117</bibl> Müll.—With a homogeneous object: <cit><quote lang="la">superbus quin etiam varicatis gressibus patet,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>striding</tr>, <tr>strutting</tr>, <tr>swaggering</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 6, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
varicose: <entryFree id="n50207" type="main" key="va^ri^co_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vărĭcōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. varicosus <sense id="n50207.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
varicosus: <entryFree id="n50208" type="main" key="va^ri^co_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vărĭcōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>varix</etym>, <sense id="n50208.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of dilated veins</hi>, <hi rend="ital">varicose</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">centuriones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:189" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 189</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haruspex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:397" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 397</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Arpinas,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Cicero</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 5, 5</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:143" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 143</bibl>; and Vatin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 3</bibl>).—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vă-rĭcōsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">full of dilated veins</hi>: varicosius onera portare, Fest. s. v. muli marini, p. 149 Müll. (acc. to others, from varicus or varico, <hi rend="ital">with feet spread apart</hi>).</sense></entryFree>
varicula: <entryFree id="n50209" type="main" key="va^ri^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vărĭcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50209.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small varix</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 26, 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
varicus: <entryFree id="n50210" type="hapax" key="va_ri^cus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vārĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. varus</etym>, <sense id="n50210.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with feet spread apart</hi>, <hi rend="ital">straddling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa ambulat varica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:304" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 304</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n50211" type="hapax" key="va_ri^cus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vārĭcus</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50211.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with feet spread apart</hi>, <hi rend="ital">straddlingly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 108, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
varie: <entryFree id="n50212" type="main" key="va^ri^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vărĭē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. varius <sense id="n50212.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
variego: <entryFree id="n50213" type="main" key="va^ri^e^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vărĭĕgo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>varius-ago</etym> (post-class.). <sense id="n50213.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make of various sorts</hi> or <hi rend="ital">colors</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to variegate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">figuras alius alio scientius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 13 praef.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">balteus miris coloribus variegatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 346, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navis picturis miris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> M. 11, p. 264, 34</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n50213.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be party-colored</hi> or <hi rend="ital">variegated</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lyra gemmis variegat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 342, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
varietas: <entryFree id="n50214" type="main" key="va^ri^e^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vărĭĕtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>varius</etym>, <sense id="n50214.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">difference</hi>, <hi rend="ital">diversity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">variety</hi> (class.; used alike in <number>sing.</number> and <number>plur.</number>): varietas Latinum verbum est, idque proprie quidem in disparibus coloribus dicitur: sed transfertur in multa disparia: varium poëma, varia oratio, varii mores, varia fortuna; <cit><quote lang="la">voluptas etiam varia dici solet, cum percipitur ex multis dissimilibus rebus dissimiliter efficientibus voluptates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:3:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">florum omnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:15:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 15, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Asia varietate fructuum facile omnibus terris antecedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut in corporibus magnae dissimilitudines sunt, sic in animis exsistunt majores etiam varietates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:30:107" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 30, 107</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:44:92" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 44, 92</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">varietates vocum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeli,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 36, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum publicarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:3:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum in multā varietate terrā marique versatum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>changes</tr>, <tr>vicissitudes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 9, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Timaeus) sententiarum varietate abundantissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:14:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 14, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse in varietate ac dissensione,</quote> <trans><tr>variety of opinion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluntatis,</quote> <trans><tr>difference of wish</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 17, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utilitatis varietates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:32:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 32, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec varietatem natura patitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 11, 18</bibl></cit>: extimescens varietatem atque infidelitatem exercitūs, <hi rend="ital">changeableness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fickleness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inconstancy</hi>, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 18, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad varietates annonae horreum fore,</quote> <trans><tr>vicissitudes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:31:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 31, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">figurarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:90" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 6, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullum exspirantem versicolori quādam et numerosā varietate spectari proceres gulae narrant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 17, 30, § 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum videamus tot varietates circumagi,</quote> <trans><tr>fluctuations of fortune</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:24:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 24, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50214.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">varied clothing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">colored attire</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumamictā varietate, Aug. Civ. Dei, 17, 16, 2: circumamicta varietatibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:44:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 44, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
varini: <entryFree id="n50215" type="main" key="Vari_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Varīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50215.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a German tribe on the Baltic Sea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 14, 28, § 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:40:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 40, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vario: <entryFree id="n50216" type="main" key="va^ri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vărĭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n50216.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v.a.</hi> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>varius</etym>. </sense><sense id="n50216.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to diversify</hi>, <hi rend="ital">variegate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">change</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n50216.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(principia) omne genus gignunt variantque colores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:759" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 759</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maculis ortum (sol),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:441" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 441</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeruleis corpora guttis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:578" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 578</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora cani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:465" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 465</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capillos (gemma),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi caeruleum variabunt sidera caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:449" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 449</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">variare virgis et loris,</quote> <trans><tr>to beat of all colors</tr>, <tr>black and blue</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. prol. 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">putrida pectora palmis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:352" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 352</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestes picto auro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:11" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">variante se uvā,</quote> <trans><tr>becoming colored</tr>, <tr>turning</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 189</bibl></cit>; for which <hi rend="ital">mid.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulatque uva variari coeperit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 12:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Arb. 12, 1</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis priscis hominum variata figuris,</quote> <trans><tr>variegated</tr>, <tr>embroidered</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pluribus ille (anguis) notis variatam pingitur alvum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:713" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 713</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcus vix ullā variatus luce colorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eluere calculos nigros paulum candore variatos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 16, 47, § 157</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: formas variatus in omnes, <hi rend="ital">changed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">metamorphosed</hi>,<cb n="VARI" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:559" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 559</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50216.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to cause to change</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make different</hi> or <hi rend="ital">various; to alter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">change</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interchange</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cause to alternate</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">vocem variare et mutare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:18:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 18, 59</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid (with mutare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:1:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationem variare et distinguere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:9:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 9, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ergo ille variabit (vocem) et mutabit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:18:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 18, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptatem (with distinguere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:11:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 11, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui variare cupit rem prodigialiter unam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in oratione multa summittere, variare, disponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:12:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 12, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:13:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 13, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:152" default="NO">11, 3, 152</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum timor atque ira in vicem sententias variassent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:57:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 57, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 164</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum variante fortunā eventum ferre,</quote> <trans><tr>with varying success</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et variebant secundae adversaeque res non fortunam magis quam animos hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fremitus variantis multitudinis fuit partim adsensu partim indignatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:31:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 31, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex vernā intemperie variante calores frigoraque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laborem otio, otium labore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">variatis hominum sententiis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>various</tr>, <tr>at variance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae de Marcelli morte variant auctores,</quote> <trans><tr>report differently</tr>, <tr>vary</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:27:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 27, 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">certe variata memoria actae rei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:28:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 28, 5</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sitne ea (beata vita) in potestate sapientis, an, etc. ... in eo nonnumquam variari inter eos et dubitari videtur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:5:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: senatus consuli coeptus; <cit><quote lang="la">ibi cum sententiis variaretur,</quote> <trans><tr>were of different opinions</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:60:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 60, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">variatum deinde proeliis,</quote> <trans><tr>fought with varying success</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:51:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 51, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi de familiae condicione variatum esset,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>differently reported</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50216.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be diversified</hi>, <hi rend="ital">variegated; to change</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">waver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vary</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n50216.5" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">prima mihi variat liventibus uva racemis,</quote> <trans><tr>becomes variegated</tr>, <tr>colored</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 2, 13: <cit><quote lang="la">bacae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:52:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 52, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">variant ostrea coloribus,</quote> <trans><tr>are different</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 6, 21, § 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">universitas (arietum) tergoris maculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter se multum variare figurae Non possunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:484" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 484</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:648" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 648</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">variantes edere formas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:722" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 722</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">volucres variantibu' formis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:825" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 825</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ita Carpathiae variant Aquilonibus undae,</quote> <trans><tr>fluctuate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:5:11" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 5, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50216.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to be various</hi> or <hi rend="ital">different; to change</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vary; absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">variante fortunā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inpatiens variantis caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 2, 4, § 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic abeunt redeuntque mei variantque timores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:153" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 153</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dissidet et variat sententia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:648" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 15, 648</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita fama variat, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:27:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 27, 14</bibl></cit>. —With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec de tanto viro, quamquam et opinionibus et monumentis litterarum variarent, proponenda erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:57:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 57, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si (lex) nec causis nec personis variet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:45:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 45, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi si variaret,</quote> <trans><tr>if there were a difference of opinion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:43:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 43, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nec variatum comitiis est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:22:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 22, 10</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">adverb. acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si nunc quoque fortuna aliquid variaverit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 13, 4</bibl></cit>.—Of differences in the text of an author (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">ipsi codices Graeci variant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:in Psa. 118:7" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> in Psa. 118, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla in eo variat codicum auctoritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:C. Faust. 11:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> C. Faust. 11, 4</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">P. a.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vărĭans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">varied</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manifold</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(terra) fudit aërias volucres variantibus formis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:822" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 822</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">variantis edere formas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:720" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 720</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">astra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 2, 466</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
varitus: <entryFree id="n50217" type="spur" key="va_ri^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vārĭtus</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, a false read. for varicus, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 108, 19</bibl>.</entryFree>
varius: <entryFree id="n50218" type="main" key="va^ri^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vărĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n50218.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">diverse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">different</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manifold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">changing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">varying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">various</hi> (cf.: diversus, distinctus). </sense><sense id="n50218.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50218.2" n="A" level="2"> Of color, etc., <hi rend="ital">variegated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">party-colored</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mottled</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">arietis lingua nigra aut varia, vestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:2:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">variā veste exornatus fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 16</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of color: uvae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 33, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">33, 73</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lynces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:264" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 264</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:619" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 619</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pica,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:7:45" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 7, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 123</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">plumae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 4, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">columnae,</quote> <trans><tr>of variegated marble</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctumnus purpureo colore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 2, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:270" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 270</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vestra latera loris faciam ut valide varia sint,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>black and blue</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 61</bibl>: tergum varium, Pomp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 19, 31</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 139 Rib.): sparsa quoque in vario passim miracula caelo videt, <hi rend="ital">diversified</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">with constellations of various forms</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 193</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50218.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vărĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (i. e. bestia, a mottled animal). </sense><sense id="n50218.4" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A panther</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:63 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 17, 23, § 63 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n50218.5" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of magpie</hi>, Plin. <pb n="1959" /> <cb n="VARR" /> 10, 29, 41, § 78.—</sense><sense id="n50218.6" n="B" level="2"> In rural lang.: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <trans><tr>wet above and dry beneath</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:4:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sulcus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 61, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 19, 49, § 174</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50218.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">diverse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">different</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manifold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">changing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">varying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">changeable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">various</hi>, etc.: varium poëma, varia oratio, varii mores, varia fortuna; <cit><quote lang="la">voluptas etiam varia dici solet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:3:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(qualitates) variae et quasi multiformes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 7, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et ea, quae videntur acerba, quae multa et varia in hominum vitā fortunāque versantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:20:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 20, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curricula multiplicium variorumque sermonum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:3:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res varia et multiplex,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multae, copiosae variaeque rationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:51:222" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 51, 222</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">varia et diversa genera et bellorum et hostium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 10, 28</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:16:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 16, 61</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 61, 262</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">varium jus et dispar condicio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:19:section=49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 19, § 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eventus varii fortunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 22</bibl></cit>: victoria, <hi rend="ital">wavering</hi>, = anceps, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 6, 10</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:26" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 12, 26</bibl></cit>. —Of opinions: varias esse opiniones intellego: sunt qui putant, etc., i. e. <hi rend="ital">divergent opinions</hi>, <hi rend="ital">differences</hi> where there is yet substantial agreement (while diversae opiniones are opposite views), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 25</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n50218.8" n="2" level="3"> Varium est, with a <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quales sint (dii), varium est,</quote> <trans><tr>various opinions prevail</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:5:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 5, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50218.9" n="B" level="2"> Esp., of persons, etc. </sense><sense id="n50218.10" n="1" level="3"> Of abilities, <hi rend="ital">versatile</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Plato et varius et multiplex et copiosus fuit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 4, 17</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">antequam scirem quam varium, quam flexibile quam multiplex (ejus ingenium) esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Antonius ingenio varius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:3:4" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 3, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50218.11" n="2" level="3"> Of character, <hi rend="ital">fickle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inconstant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">changeable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">untrustworthy</hi>: miror quid sit, quod pater tuus, homo constantissimus, te nobis varium reliquit (<hi rend="ital">beaten black and blue</hi>, and <hi rend="ital">fickle-minded</hi>,) Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:48" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus audax, subdolus, varius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">varius incertusque agitabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 74:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 74, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voltu et oculis pariter atque animo varius,</quote> <trans><tr>agitated</tr>, <tr>irresolute</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 113:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 113, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pausanias magnus homo, sed varius in omni genere vitae fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">varium et mutabile semper Femina,</quote> <trans><tr>a fickle thing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:569" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 569</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vărĭē</orth>. </sense><sense id="n50218.12" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">with diverse colors</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in a variegated manner</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mithrax gemma multicolor, contra solem varie refulgens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 63, § 173</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">smaragdi Cyprii varie glauci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 5, 18, § 67</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n50218.13" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">variously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">changeably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">diversely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">differently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in various ways</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">varie moveri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:42:89" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 42, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (sermones) ab his, qui illum audierunt, perscripti varie et copiose sunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerus hujus generis late et varie diffusus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:45:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 45, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">varie sum affectus tuis litteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 16, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postea decernitur, ac non varie, sed prope cunctis sententiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:65:section=145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 65, § 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita varie per omnem exercitum laetitia, maeror, luctus atque gaudia agitabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 61:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 61, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Aequis varie bellatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:28:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 28, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agere varie, rogando alternis suadendoque coepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hiemem aut negotia varie causari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sagittarios varie passimque collocare, Auct. B. Afr. 60: disserere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 11</bibl></cit>.—With a punning allusion to 1. Varia: <hi rend="ital">Ep.</hi> Perpetuon' valuisti? <hi rend="ital">Th.</hi> Varie. <hi rend="ital">Ep.</hi> Qui varie valent, caprigenum hominum non placet mihi neque pantherinum genus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n50219" type="main" key="Va^ri^us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vărĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n50219.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens; esp., </sense><sense id="n50219.1" n="I" level="1"> Q. Varius <hi rend="ital">of Sucro</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Spain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called Hybrida</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a tribune of the people</hi> A.U.C. 663, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:25:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 25, 117</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:49:182" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 49, 182</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">62, 221</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:3:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 3, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50219.2" n="II" level="1"> L. Varius, <hi rend="ital">a tragic poet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contemporary with Virgil and Horace</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 9, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:98" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:18:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 18, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
varix: <entryFree id="n50220" type="main" key="va^rix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vărix</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> and <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. varus</etym>, <sense id="n50220.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dilated vein</hi>, <hi rend="ital">varix</hi>, esp. in the thighs, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 17</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 7, 31; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 26, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">167, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:15:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 15, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 78:17" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 78, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:252" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 45, 104, § 252</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:143" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 143</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 3, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
varo: <entryFree id="n50221" type="hapax" key="va_ro1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vāro</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50221.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stupid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">boorish fellow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a clodpate</hi>, Lucil. ap. Fest. s. v. squarrosi, pp. 328 and 329 Müll.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n50222" type="main" key="va_ro2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vāro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>1. varus</etym>, <sense id="n50222.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">curve</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">alveos pontium, Auct. Limit. p. 257 Goes.: flumen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> p. 285.</sense></entryFree>
varro: <entryFree id="n50223" type="main" key="Varro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Varro</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50223.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname in the</hi> gens Terentia, e. g. </sense><sense id="n50223.1" n="I" level="1"> M. Terentius Varro, <hi rend="ital">a contemporary of Cicero</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who wrote</hi> De Re Rusticā <hi rend="ital">and</hi> De Linguā Latinā.—</sense><sense id="n50223.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The</hi> <cb n="VAS" /> <hi rend="ital">poet</hi> P. Terentius Varro Atacinus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 46</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50223.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The consul</hi> C. Terentius Varro, <hi rend="ital">defeated at Cannœ</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:34:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 34, 2</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Varrōnĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Varro</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Varronian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of the consul C. Terentius Varro</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:38:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 38, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenia,</quote> <trans><tr>of M. Terentius Varro</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 1 praef.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comoediae,</quote> <trans><tr>the collection of the twenty-one genuine comedies of Plautus</tr>, <tr>arranged by M. Terentius Varro</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:3:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 3, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
varus: <entryFree id="n50224" type="main" key="va_rus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vārus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>perh. root kar, kvar; whence Sanscr. kakras, wheel; Lat. circus, curvus, and vārus, for cvarus; cf. Corss. Ausspr. 1, 412</etym>, <sense id="n50224.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stretched</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">grown inwards</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">awry.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50224.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(canes) debent esse cruribus rectis et potius varis quam vatiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:9:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 9, 4</bibl></cit>; hence of persons <hi rend="ital">with legs bent inwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">knock-kneed</hi> (cf. valgus): hunc varum distortis cruribus; <cit><quote lang="la">illum Balbutit scaurum pravis fultum male talis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 47</bibl></cit> (cf. Orelli et Dillenb. ad loc.); Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 26, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:4:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 4, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 1, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>bent</tr>, <tr>crooked</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bracchia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:32:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 32, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:850" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 850</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:382" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 382</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 3, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">talea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:9:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 9, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50224.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">diverse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">different</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>); <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">geminos, Horoscope, varo Producis genio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:18" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 6, 18</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alterum (genus hominum) et huic varum et nihilo sapientius,</quote> <trans><tr>different from this</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 56</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n50225" type="main" key="va^rus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vărus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50225.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an eruption</hi> on the face, <hi rend="ital">a blotch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pimple</hi>, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">i)/onqos</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 25, 73, § 151</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:19" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 1, 14, § 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:85" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 4, 42, § 85</bibl>; 23, 4, 45, § 89.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n50226" type="main" key="Va_rus3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vārus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50226.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname</hi>, esp. in the gens Quintilia; <cit><quote lang="la">e. g. P. Quintilius Varus,</quote> <trans><tr>defeated by Arminius</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:117" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 117</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 43</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 55</bibl>; 1, 60 al.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vārĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Varus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Varian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">clades,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
varvari: <entryFree id="n50227" type="main" key="Varvari"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Varvari</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50227.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Istria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 19, 23, § 130</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
varvarini: <entryFree id="n50228" type="main" key="Varvarini"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Varvarini</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50228.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Liburnia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 22, 25, § 139</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vas: <entryFree id="n50229" type="main" key="va^s1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">văs</orth>, <itype>vădis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50229.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">security</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surety</hi> (in gen., while praes is confined to pecuniary matters; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also sponsio): vas appellatus, qui pro altero vadimonium promittebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:74" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, 74</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">vas factus est alter (Damon) ejus sistendi, ut si ille non revertisset, moriendum esset ipsi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:10:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 10, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vades poscere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:36:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 36, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se dare vadem pro amico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:24:79" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 24, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deserere vades,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:41:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 41, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 11</bibl> Heind.—</sense><sense id="n50229.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestram virtutem rerum quas gesturus sum, vadem praedemque habeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:2:25" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 2, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n50230" type="main" key="va_s2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vās</orth>, vāsis; <number>plur.</number> <orth extent="full" lang="la">vāsa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype> (anteclass. collat. form of the <sense id="n50230.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nom. sing.</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">vāsum</orth>, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:23:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 23, 1</bibl>; Fab. Pict. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 544, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:33 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 33 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vasus fictilis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 57, 8</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">dat. plur.</hi> vasibus, Gargil. Martial. Pomif. Arb. 4, 4; apocopated, vas' argenteis, for vasis, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:45:153" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 45, 153</bibl>), <gen>n.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. root, vas-, to put on; vastram, clothing; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e(/nnumi, ei(=ma</foreign>; Lat. vestis</etym>. </sense><sense id="n50230.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a vessel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dish;</hi> also, <hi rend="ital">a utensil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">implement</hi> of any kind: <cit><quote lang="la">vasa ahena ex aedibus (rapere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 2, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquod vasum argenteum Aut aliquod vasum ahenum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil relinquo in aedibus Nec vas nec vestimentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus quasi vas est, aut aliquod animi receptaculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:22:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 22, 52</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,013:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Thess. 4, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quassatis undique vasis, Diffluere umorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:435" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 435</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sincerum est nisi vas, quodcumque infundis acescit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinarium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:27:section=62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 27, § 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argentea,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>;
