<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Corinthia et Deliaca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:46:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 46, 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Samia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:36:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 36, 75</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">escaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 2, 7, § 18</bibl></cit>.—Of <hi rend="ital">implements</hi> for supporting any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">si vasa sint legata, non solum ea continentur, quae aliquid in se recipiunt edendi bibendique causā paratum, sed etiam quae aliquid sustineant: et ideo scutellas vel promulsidaria contineri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:20" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 2, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50230.2" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Military equipments</hi>, <hi rend="ital">baggage</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille ex Siciliā jam castra commoverat et vasa collegerat,</quote> <trans><tr>had packed up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:19:section=40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 19, § 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vasa colligere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:47:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 47, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:47:8" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 47, 8</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">trop.: vasa in senectute colligere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 19:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 19, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vasa conclamare,</quote> <trans><tr>to give the signal for packing up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 66</bibl></cit>: 3, 37.—</sense><sense id="n50230.3" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Agricultural<cb n="VAST" />  implements</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vasa quae utilia culturae sunt, aratrum, ligones, sarcula, falces, bidentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 7, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50230.4" n="4" level="3"> Of <hi rend="ital">beehives</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:6:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 6, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50230.5" n="5" level="3"> Of <hi rend="ital">hunting implements</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyn. 219</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50230.6" n="II" level="1"> In mal. part., <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 70</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">in a double sense,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 41</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vasarium: <entryFree id="n50231" type="main" key="va_sa_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vāsārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>2. vas</etym>. <sense id="n50231.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Furniture-money</hi>, <hi rend="ital">equipage-money</hi>, given to a governor of a province for his domestic establishment, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:35:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 35, 86</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50231.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Money given for the hire of an oil-mill</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 145, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50231.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The furniture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">movables</hi> in a bath, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50231.3" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Archives</hi>, <hi rend="ital">records</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 49, 50, § 162</bibl>; Cod. Th. 13, 11, 12; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 7, 45 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
vasates: <entryFree id="n50232" type="main" key="Va_^sa_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vā^sātes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vā^sātae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50232.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Aquitania</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Parent. 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 11, 14</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vā^sātĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Vasates</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rheda,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 7, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vasatus: <entryFree id="n50233" type="main" key="va_sa_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vāsātus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>2. vas <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></etym>, i. e. magnā mentulā instructus (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 31</bibl>.</entryFree>
vascellum: <entryFree id="n50234" type="gloss" key="vascellum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vascellum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>2. vas</etym>, <sense id="n50234.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small vase</hi> or <hi rend="ital">urn</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4555</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vascones: <entryFree id="n50235" type="main" key="Vasco^nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vascŏnes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50235.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people in</hi> Hispania Tarraconensis, <hi rend="ital">on the Pyrenees</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the modern Navarra</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the parent stock of the Basques</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:93" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 93</bibl>.—As <pos>adj.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vascŏnis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <hi rend="ital">of the Vascones</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">saltu,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Pyrenees</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 10, 311</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n50235.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vascŏnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the country of the Vascones</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 10, 202</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50235.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vascŏnĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Vascones</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 10, 217</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vascularius: <entryFree id="n50236" type="main" key="vascu^la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vascŭlārĭus</orth> (contr. VASCLARIVS, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Maff.</author> Mus. Ver. 291, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> p. 17</bibl>, n. 75), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>vasculum</etym>, <sense id="n50236.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who makes vessels of metal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a worker in metals</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a whitesmith</hi>, <hi rend="ital">goldsmith</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:24:section=54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 24, § 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:5:21" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 5, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:39" default="NO">34, 2, 39</bibl> pr.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4276</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vasculum: <entryFree id="n50237" type="main" key="vascu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vascŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>2. vas</etym>, <sense id="n50237.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small vessel.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50237.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50237.2" n="1" level="3"> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 111</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:10:9" default="NO">7, 10, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:141" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 141</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50237.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A small beehive</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Jun. 7, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50237.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50237.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The seed-capsule</hi> of certain plants, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 28, 34, § 115</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:52" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 7, 10, § 52</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50237.6" n="2" level="3"> = membrum virile, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
vascus: <entryFree id="n50238" type="main" key="vascus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vascus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>perh. incorrectly for vastus</etym>: <sense id="n50238.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">tibia,</quote> <trans><tr>a kind of flute</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 11, 737</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vastabundus: <entryFree id="n50239" type="hapax" key="vasta_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vastābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vasto</etym>, <sense id="n50239.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wasting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">desolating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">devastating</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 8, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vastatio: <entryFree id="n50240" type="main" key="vasta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vastātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50240.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a laying waste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">desolating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ravaging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">devastation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 8, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:Or. ad Caes. 1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> Or. ad Caes. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">villarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 15</bibl></cit> 11; 10, 4, 7; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:4:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 4, 14</bibl>: Italiam a vastatione defendere, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 15, 4</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">intactum vastationibus regnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vastator: <entryFree id="n50241" type="main" key="vasta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vastātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50241.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a desolater</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ravager</hi>, <hi rend="ital">devastater</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">Arcadiae aper,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 192</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferus (i. e. lupus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:395" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 395</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferarum Amycus,</quote> <trans><tr>destroyer</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:772" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 772</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Trojae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 2, 318</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gentium (Alexander),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:13:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 13, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vastatorius: <entryFree id="n50242" type="main" key="vasta_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vastātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50242.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wasting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ravaging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">devastating</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">manus hostium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 18, 6, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">globus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 19, 9, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vastatrix: <entryFree id="n50243" type="hapax" key="vasta_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vastātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vastator</etym>, <sense id="n50243.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a</hi> (female) <hi rend="ital">waster</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ravager</hi>, <hi rend="ital">devastater;</hi> trop.: <cit><quote lang="la">luxuria terrarum marisque vastatrix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 95:19" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 95, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vaste: <entryFree id="n50244" type="main" key="vaste_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vastē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. vastus <sense id="n50244.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
vastesco: <entryFree id="n50245" type="hapax" key="vastesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vastesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n50245.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [vastus], <hi rend="ital">to become desert</hi> or <hi rend="ital">waste</hi>: ne scelere tuo Thebani vastescant agri, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 185, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vastificus: <entryFree id="n50246" type="hapax" key="vasti^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vastĭfĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vastus-facio</etym>, <sense id="n50246.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">laying waste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ravaging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">devastating</hi>: Erymanthia vastifica belua, Cic. poët. Tusc. 2, 9, 22.</sense></entryFree>
vastitas: <entryFree id="n50247" type="main" key="vasti^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vastĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vastus</etym>, <sense id="n50247.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an empty place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a waste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">desert.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50247.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: te propter tot tantasque habemus vastitatis funerum, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 417, 12</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 175 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">audistis, quae solitudo in agris esset, quae vastitas, quae fuga aratorum, quam deserta, quam inculta, quam relicta omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:5:section=114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 5, § 114</bibl></cit>; so (with solitudo) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 55</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">judiciorum et fori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 6</bibl></cit>, <pb n="1960" /> <cb n="VAST" /> 21.—</sense><sense id="n50247.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (acc. to vastus, II.). </sense><sense id="n50247.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Desolation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">devastation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destruction</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum caedem a vobis, vastitatem a templis, urbe, Italiā depellebam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Italiam totam ad exitium et vastitatem vocas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vastitatem efficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:35:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 35, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inferre vastitatem tectis atque agris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut studiis civilibus bellum atque vastitas Italiae finem faceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vastitatem reddere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 26, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et plus vastitatis hinc urbi secunda nostra fortuna faciet, quam adversa fecit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:51:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 51, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugam ac vastitatem late fecerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:9:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 9, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">protritis arboribus ac frugibus dira vastitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 70</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50247.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">et has duplices pestis sociorum, publicanorum ruinas, provinciarum vastitates,</quote> <trans><tr>destroyers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 6, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50247.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Terrible size</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hugeness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immensity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vastness</hi> (post-Aug.; <cit><quote lang="la">but cf. vastus, II. B.): beluae pari vastitate,</quote> <trans><tr>of like vast size</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:8:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">roborum Hercyniae silvae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 2, 2, § 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">immensa aequorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3</bibl></cit>, praef. 1, § <cit><quote lang="la">1: hostis formidandae vastitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:13:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 13, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 41, 41, § 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 11, 8, § 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 6, 32, § 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:9:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 9, 2</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n50247.6" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vastitas instantis laboris,</quote> <trans><tr>the fearful magnitude</tr>, <tr>immensity</tr>, <tr>vastness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:18:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 18, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scientiae rei rusticae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vastities: <entryFree id="n50248" type="hapax" key="vasti^ti^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vastĭtĭes</orth>, <itype>ēi</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vastus</etym>, = vastitas, II. A., <sense id="n50248.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ruin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destruction</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptatum omnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 68</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vastitudo: <entryFree id="n50249" type="main" key="vasti^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vastĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n50249.0" n="I" level="1"> = vastitas, II. A., <hi rend="ital">ruin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destruction</hi> (ante-class.): Mars pater, te precor ... ut tu morbos visos invisosque, viduertatem vastitudinemque, calamitates intemperiasque prohibessis, an old formula of prayer ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 141, 2</bibl>: quae vastitudo haec aut unde invasit mihi? Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 184, 32</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 455 Rib.); Pac. ib. (Trag. Rel. v. 314 ib.).—* </sense><sense id="n50249.1" n="II" level="1"> = vastitas, II. B., <hi rend="ital">fearful size</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hugeness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immensity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:14:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 14, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vasto: <entryFree id="n50250" type="main" key="vasto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vasto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.; hence, Ital. guastar, and Fr. gāter</etym>, <sense id="n50250.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make empty</hi> or <hi rend="ital">vacant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to leave untenanted</hi> or <hi rend="ital">uninhabited</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to desert.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50250.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">lex erat lata de vastato ac relicto foro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:24:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 24, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vastati agri sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:32:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 32, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venator vastata lustra fugit,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>destitute of game</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:480" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 480</bibl></cit>: pati terram stirpium asperitate vastari, <hi rend="ital">to lie waste</hi> or <hi rend="ital">untilled</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:39:99" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 39, 99</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50250.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to empty</hi> or <hi rend="ital">deprive of inhabitants</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to lay waste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">desolate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ravage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">devastate; to ruin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destroy</hi> (the predom. signif. of the word; syn.: populor, vexo). </sense><sense id="n50250.3" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum equitatus liberius praedandi vastandique causā se in agros ejecerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50250.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse ad vastandos depopulandosque fines Ambiorigis proficiscitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:24" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:66:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 66, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:50:section=119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 50, § 119</bibl> (with exinanire): <cit><quote lang="la">Italiam (with diripere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:39:99" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 39, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partem provinciae incursionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia caedibus, incendiis, ruinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:25" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia ferro ignique vastata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:30:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 30, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:12:7" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 12, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia (with invadere, polluere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 41:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 41, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia igni ferroque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:110:6" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 110, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tydides multā vastabat caede cruentus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:471" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 471</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia late vastant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fana Poenorum tumultu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:4:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 4, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(zonae) vastantur frigore semper,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:153" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 153</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuncta (panthera),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">direpti vastatique classe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos (Mardos) vastavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 14, 23</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.—Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsi cultores arvaque maturis jam frugibus ut hostile solum vastabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 87 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—With <case>abl.</case> of that which is destroyed or removed: <cit><quote lang="la">et latos vastant cultoribus agros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agrosque viris annosaque vastant oppida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:576" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 576</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50250.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita conscientia mentem excitam vastabat,</quote> <trans><tr>harassed</tr>, <tr>perplexed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 15, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vastulus: <entryFree id="n50251" type="hapax" key="vastu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vastŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vastus, II.</etym>, <sense id="n50251.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rather huge</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bulky</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 128, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vastus: <entryFree id="n50252" type="main" key="vastus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vastus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cf.: vanus, vacuus</etym>, <sense id="n50252.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">empty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unoccupied</hi>, i.e. <hi rend="ital">waste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">desert.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50252.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (so rare but class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: vacuus, desertus): genus agrorum propter pestilentiam vastum atque desertum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:26:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 26, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex erat lata vasto ac relicto foro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:24:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 24, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agrum vastum ac desertum habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:11:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 11, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vasta ac deserta urbs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 3, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:7:12" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 7, 12</bibl>: vasta incendiis ruinisque <cb n="VATE" /> urbs, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:53:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 53, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mons vastus ab naturā et humano cultu,</quote> <trans><tr>uncultivated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 48:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 48, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbs a defensoribus vasta,</quote> <trans><tr>without</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:30:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 30, 7</bibl></cit> (al. ex conj. vacua).—</sense><sense id="n50252.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (the fig. taken from tracts of country lying waste or untilled), <hi rend="ital">uncultivated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unpolished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rude</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harsh</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultu motuque corporis vasti atque agrestes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:25:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 25, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vastus homo atque foedus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 25, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vasti quidam et insubidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:9:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 9, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugiemus crebras vocalium concursiones, quae vastam atque hiantem orationem reddunt, ut hoc est: baccae aeneae amoenissimae impendebant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 12, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia vasta ac temeraria esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:48:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 48, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">littera vastior,</quote> <trans><tr>too harsh-sounding</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:45:153" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 45, 153</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50252.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50252.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Desolate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deserted</hi>: abs te viduae et vastae virgines sunt, <hi rend="ital">made lonely</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 1, 52</bibl> (Trag. v. 279 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">dies per silentium vastus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50252.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Wasted</hi> by destruction, <hi rend="ital">laid waste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ravaged</hi>, <hi rend="ital">devastated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destroyed</hi> (rare; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">vastatus): fit vasta Troja,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam hanc urbem ferro vastam faciet Peleus, Att. ap. Fest. pp. 372 and 373: haec ego vasta dabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:323" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 323</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec solum modo vastum hosti relictum, sed castellis etiam vicisque illatus ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:12:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 12, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50252.6" n="C" level="2"> With the predom. idea of extent, <hi rend="ital">vast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immense</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enormous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">huge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">monstrous</hi> (syn.: ingens, immanis). </sense><sense id="n50252.7" n="1" level="3"> Of size: jamque fere pulvis ad caelum vasta videtur, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 217, 11</bibl> (Ann. v. 286 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">immani et vastae insidens beluae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:40:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 40, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vasta et immanis belua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:24:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 24, 49</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vastissimae beluae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:26:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 26, 49</bibl></cit>: elephanto beluarum nulla prudentior; <cit><quote lang="la">ad figuram quae vastior?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:35:97" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 35, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summa erat vasto atque aperto mari, difficultas navigandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in vastissimo atque apertissimo Oceano,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 9, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fossa vastissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:6:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solitudines,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 6, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">campi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Charybdis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:722" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 722</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antiquus crater, quem vastum vastior ipse Sustulit Aegides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:236" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 236</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hiatus speluncae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 237</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspectus turris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 530</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:322" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 322</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:768" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 768</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:12:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 12, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50252.8" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of degree, etc., <hi rend="ital">immense</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enormous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prodigious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vast</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>on the vast ocean</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:438" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 438</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:553" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 553</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impetus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:14:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 14, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnae Cannensis clades vastissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:17:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 17, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:20:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 20, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vapores vastissimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:20:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 20, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:716" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 716</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:494" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 494</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">murmur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:245" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 245</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:12:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tonitru,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:617" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 617</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pondus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:447" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 447</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 9, 88</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50252.9" n="3" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vastus animus,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>insatiable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 5, 4</bibl></cit>.—Rarely with abstr. nouns: <cit><quote lang="la">quam vasta potentia nostra est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:520" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 520</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">varia vastaque scientia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1</bibl></cit>, pr. 28: <cit><quote lang="la">nefas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 767" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 767</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vastē</orth>. </sense><sense id="n50252.10" n="1" level="3"> (Acc. to vastus, I. B.) <hi rend="ital">Rudely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harshly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">loqui non aspere, non vaste, non rustice, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:12:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 12, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne vastius diducantur verba,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 43, 172</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50252.11" n="2" level="3"> (Acc. to II. B.) <hi rend="ital">Widely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vastly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immensely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enormously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vaste cedentia litora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:1:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vastius insurgens decimae ruit impetus undae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:530" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 530</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vastius podagra correpti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 107" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 107</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vasum: <entryFree id="n50253" type="main" key="va_sum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vāsum</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">vāsus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. 2. vas <sense id="n50253.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
vates: <entryFree id="n50254" type="main" key="va_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vātes</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">vātis</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:5:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 5, 12</bibl> Christ.), is (<sense id="n50254.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> vatium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:8:20 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 8, 20 al.</bibl>), <gen>comm.</gen> <etym>perh. kindr. with Sanscr. vad, dicere, loqui; cf.: vas, vadis, and old Irish, fáith</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a foreteller</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">soothsayer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prophet.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50254.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonus vates poteras esse: nam quae sunt futura dicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 3, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">falsus utinam vates sim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:10:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 10, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:46:5" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 46, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 15, 2</bibl>; Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:58:132" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 58, 132</bibl> (Trag. v. 356 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 102</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:8:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 8, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:20:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 20, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes">39, 8, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:16:8" default="NO" valid="yes">39, 16, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 1:48:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 1, 48, 3</bibl> Dietsch; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:491" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 491</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 387</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 392</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:246" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 246</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 524</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:6 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 6 al.</bibl> —<hi rend="ital">Fem.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuque, o sanctissima vates, Praescia venturi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vatis sub tecta Sibyllae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 211</bibl></cit>; 3, 187; 6, 636; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 37" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 37</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50254.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50254.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A poet; a poetess</hi> (the oldest name for a poet; but it fell into contempt, and was discarded for poëta, until restored to honor by Vergil; v. Munro ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 102</bibl>; Müll. de re Metr. p. 65 sq.): versibu' quos olim Fauni<cb n="VATI" />  vatesque canebant, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:19:76" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 19, 76</bibl> (Ann. v. 222 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 1, 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 20, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 6, 44</bibl>; 4, 9, 28; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:48" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:24" default="NO">12, 10, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 4, 6, § 56</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=36" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 36</bibl> Müll.—<hi rend="ital">Fem.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sola tuum vates Lesbia vincit opus,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>Sappho</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:7:20" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 7, 20</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n50254.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An oracle</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a teacher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">master</hi>, <hi rend="ital">authority</hi> in any art or profession (post-Aug. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">Herophilus medicinae vates mirandā arte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 88, § 219</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Q. Scaevola legum clarissimus et certissimus vates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:12:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 12, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vatia: <entryFree id="n50255" type="main" key="va^ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vătĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. vatius.</entryFree>
vaticaherba: <entryFree id="n50256" type="main" key="vatica herba"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vatica herba</orth>, <sense id="n50256.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> Apollinaria, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 74</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vaticanus: <entryFree id="n50257" type="main" key="Va_ti_^ca_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vātī^cānus</orth> (<sense id="n50257.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">i</hi> short, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:20:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 20, 7</bibl>, but lengthened in Juv. and Mart.), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> (sc. mons, collis), <hi rend="ital">the Vatican Hill in Rome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the western bank of the Tiber</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:20:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 20, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:344" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 344</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=379" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 379</bibl> Müll.; cf. Becker, Antiq. 1, p. 659 sq.; also <number>plur.</number>, for <hi rend="ital">the hill and the space around it</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">montes Vaticani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:33:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 33, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">campus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:35:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 35, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vallis,</quote> <trans><tr>between the Vatican and the Janiculum</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Circus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 40, 76, § 201</bibl></cit>: Vaticana (sc. vina), <hi rend="ital">Vatican wine</hi> (a very inferior sort), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:92:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 92, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:45:5" default="NO">10, 45, 5</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">cadus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:19:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 19, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:48:14" default="NO">12, 48, 14</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Vaticano,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 14, 14, § 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:237" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 44, 87, § 237</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:20" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 3, 4, § 20</bibl>: Vaticanus, <hi rend="ital">the divinity presiding over the Vatican</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:17:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 17, 2</bibl>; Aug. Civ. Dei, 4, 8, 12.</sense></entryFree>
vaticinatio: <entryFree id="n50258" type="main" key="va_ti^ci^na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vātĭcĭnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vaticinor</etym>, <sense id="n50258.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a foretelling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">soothsaying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prophesying; a prediction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vaticination</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:3:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 3, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 12, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:8:10" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 8, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:59" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:20:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 20, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vaticinator: <entryFree id="n50259" type="main" key="va_ti^ci^na_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vātĭcĭnātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym> <sense id="n50259.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a soothsayer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prophet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:1:42" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 1, 42</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Ham. 343</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vaticinatrix: <entryFree id="n50260" type="main" key="va_ti^ci^na_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vātĭcĭnātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vaticinator</etym>, <sense id="n50260.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a prophetess</hi>, <hi rend="ital">female fortune-teller</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. E. 9, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 443</bibl>; Mythogr. Lat. 1, 10; 3, 3, 9 Bode.</sense></entryFree>
vaticinium: <entryFree id="n50261" type="main" key="va_ti^ci^ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vātĭcĭnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>vaticinus</etym>, <sense id="n50261.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a prediction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prophecy</hi> (post-Aug. for vaticinatio, oraculum, praedictio), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 52, 53, § 178</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:17:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 17, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 4, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 10, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 6, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Chron. 2, 1, 109</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vaticinius: <entryFree id="n50262" type="main" key="va_ti^ci^ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vātĭcĭnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> <etym>vaticinor</etym>, <sense id="n50262.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">prophetic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vaticinal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">libri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 1, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:16:8" default="NO" valid="yes">39, 16, 8</bibl> Weissenb. (al. vaticinos).</sense></entryFree>
vaticinor: <entryFree id="n50263" type="main" key="va_ti^ci^nor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vātĭcĭnor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n50263.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [vates], <hi rend="ital">to foretell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">predict</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prophesy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forebode</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vaticinate</hi> (syn.: ominor, divino). </sense><sense id="n50263.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">furor vera vaticinatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:31:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 31, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod et somniantibus saepe contingit et vaticinantibus per furorem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 18, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec duce praedico vaticinorque deo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:4:94" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 4, 94</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:41:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 41, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 15, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:278" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 278</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:268 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ib. 268 al.</bibl>—With <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">saevam laesi fore numinis iram Vaticinatus erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">8, 773</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">parcite, vaticinor, cognatas caede nefandā Exturbare animas,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>I warn you as a prophet</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 174</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">venturi praescia Manto Per medias fuerat ... Vaticinata vias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:159" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 159</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vaticinor moneoque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:1:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 1, 1, 47</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50263.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50263.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To sing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">celebrate</hi> as a poet: <cit><quote lang="la">Agrigentinum quidem doctum quendam virum carminibus Graecis vaticinatum ferunt, quae in rerum naturā totoque mundo constarent quaeque moverentur, ea contrahere amicitiam, dissipare discordiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:7:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 7, 24</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Ps.</hi> Parricida ... Sacrilege ... Perjure. <hi rend="ital">Ba.</hi> Vetera vaticinamini, <hi rend="ital">you're singing the old song</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 129</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n50263.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To rave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">talk foolish stuff</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vaticinari atque insanire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:10:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 10, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed ego fortasse vaticinor, et haec omnia meliores habebunt exitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 16, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vaticinus: <entryFree id="n50264" type="main" key="va_ti^ci^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vātĭcĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50264.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">prophetical</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vaticinal</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and rare; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">vaticinius): furores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:640" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 640</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vatienus: <entryFree id="n50265" type="main" key="Vati^e_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vatĭēnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>: <sense id="n50265.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">P. Vatienus,</quote> <trans><tr>a countryman to whom Castor and Pollux are said to have announced the victory of the Romans over Perseus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vatinianus: <entryFree id="n50266" type="main" key="Va^ti_ni^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vătīnĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Vatinius, I.</entryFree>
vatinius: <entryFree id="n50267" type="main" key="Va^ti_ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vătīnĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50267.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:254" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 45, 105, § 254</bibl>.—So esp., </sense><sense id="n50267.1" n="I" level="1"> P. Vatinius, <hi rend="ital">a Roman vehemently denounced by Cicero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 1, 1</bibl> sqq.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vă-tīnĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Vatinius</hi>, whose name became a proverb <pb n="1961" /> <cb n="VECO" /> of disrepute: <cit><quote lang="la">Vatiniana crimina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:53:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 53, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vatinianum odium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Const. 17:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Const. 17, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50267.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A shoemaker and maker of fournozzled drinking-cups</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:96:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 96, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50267.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">drinking-cups made by Vatinius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:3:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 3, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vatius: <entryFree id="n50268" type="main" key="va^ti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vătĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n50268.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bent outwards</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(canes) sint cruribus rectis et potius varis quam vatiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:9:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 9, 4</bibl></cit>; hence, of <hi rend="ital">persons with legs bent out wards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bowlegged</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaesitum est, an balbus et blaesus ... et varus et vatius sanus sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 1, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:70:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 70, 1</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vătĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a bowlegged man</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">imitari vatias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=10" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 10</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 45, 105, § 204</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vatrax: <entryFree id="n50269" type="hapax" key="va_^trax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vā^trax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">vā^trĭcōsus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <sense id="n50269.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. m.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with crooked feet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">club-footed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vatrax et vatricosus pedibus vitiosis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 25, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:28" default="NO"><author>Lucil.</author> 28</bibl>, ap. Non. l. l.</sense></entryFree>
vatrenus: <entryFree id="n50270" type="main" key="Va_^trenus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vā^trenus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50270.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river of</hi> Gallia Cispadana <hi rend="ital">falling into the Po</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">the Santerno</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 16, 20, § 119</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:66:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 66, 2</bibl> (al. Vaterno).</sense></entryFree>
ve: <entryFree id="n50271" type="main" key="ve^1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕ</orth> <etym>perh. from same root with vel, volo; but cf. Sanscr. va, or</etym>, <sense id="n50271.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">or;</hi> leaving the choice free between two things or among several (always enclitic): <cit><quote lang="la">quid tu es tristis? quidve es alacris?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">telum tormentumve,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lubidines iracundiaeve,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:38:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 38, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">albus aterve fueris, ignorans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:16:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 16, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si id facis facturave es,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quid plus minusve faxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 3, 3, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quid plus minusve, quam sit necesse, dicat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duabus tribusve horis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 14, 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Appius ad me ex itinere bis terve litteras miserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amici regis duo tresve perdivites sunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum eam (quercum) tempestas vetustasve consumpserit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alter ambove, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 19, 53</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. alter: aliquis unus pluresve,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:32:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 32, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne cui meae Longinquitas aetatis obstet mortemve exspectet meam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eho, Mysis, puer hic unde est? quisve huc attulit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 4, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quando aut regi justo vim populus attulit regnove eum spoliavit, aut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:42:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 42, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decretumque, ut consules sortirentur conpararentve inter se, uter, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: quae civitates habent legibus sanctum, si quis quid de re publica a finitimis rumore ac famā acceperit, uti ad magistratum deferat, neve cum quo alio communicet, <hi rend="ital">or</hi> (sc. it is ordered by law) <hi rend="ital">that he shall not</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50271.1" n="2" level="3"> Esp. in neg. sentences, or questions implying a negat., = -que: nullum (membrum rei publicae) reperies perfecti, quod non fractum debilitatumve sit, Cic Fam. 5, 13, 3; <cit><quote lang="la">num leges nostras moresve novit?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 5, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50271.2" n="B" level="2"> Repeated or with <hi rend="ital">correl. part.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50271.3" n="1" level="3"> Ve ... ve, <hi rend="ital">either ... or</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">corpora vertuntur: nec quod fuimusve sumusve, Cras erimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:215" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 215</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullaque laudetur plusve minusve mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:110" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 5, 110</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:493" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 11, 493</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa tamen se Non habitu mutatve loco, peccatve superne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 64</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50271.4" n="2" level="3"> Ve ... aut, <hi rend="ital">either ... or</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">regnave prima Remi aut animos Carthaginis altae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:1:23" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 1, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n50272" type="main" key="ve_2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vē-</orth> (sometimes <orth extent="full" lang="la">vae-</orth>) [perh. = Sanscr. vi-in-, vi-dha-va; Lat. vidua; but cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:Gr. Etym. p. 3809:135" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> Gr. Etym. p. 3809, 135</bibl>]; an inseparable particle denoting origin, <sense id="n50272.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">out</hi>, which serves either to negative the positive idea lying in the simple word, or to strengthen a simple notion: vegrandis, <hi rend="ital">small;</hi> vecors, <hi rend="ital">senseless;</hi> vepallidus, <hi rend="ital">very pale;</hi> ve-stigo, <hi rend="ital">to search out;</hi> Vejovis, <hi rend="ital">an anti-Jove;</hi> cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:12:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 12, 9</bibl> sqq.</sense></entryFree>
vecilius: <entryFree id="n50273" type="main" key="Vecili^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vecilĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50273.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain in Latium</hi>, perh a spur of the Algidus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 50</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vecordia: <entryFree id="n50274" type="main" key="ve_cordia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vēcordia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vecors</etym>, <sense id="n50274.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">want of reason</hi>, <hi rend="ital">senselessness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">silliness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">folly; madness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insanity</hi> (not in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">tanta vecordia innata cuiquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prorsus in facie voltuque vecordia inerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 15, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui vecordiam objectare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 94:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 94, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">studia plena vecordiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formidine quasi vecordiā exagitari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 72:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 72, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:99:3" default="NO" valid="yes">99, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">plurima vecordia constantiam exemerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 22</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 227</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentes vatum in vecordiam vertere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:6:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 24, 6, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">egregie homo improbus atque immani vecordiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:1:8" default="NO">12, 1, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vecors: <entryFree id="n50275" type="main" key="ve_cors"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vē-cors</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">vāecors</orth>), <itype>cordis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cor</etym>, <sense id="n50275.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">destitute of reason; senseless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">silly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foolish;</hi> <cb n="VECT" /> <hi rend="ital">mad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insane</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">excors, delirus, vesanus): aliis cor ipsum animus videtur: ex quo excordes, vaecordes concordesque dicuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:9:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 9, 18</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vecors est turbati et mali cordis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=372" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 372</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">ego te non vaecordem, non furiosum, non mente captum, non tragico illo Oreste dementiorem putem?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:20:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 20, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:50:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 50, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:49:11" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 49, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:291" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 291</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 74</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelere et metu vecors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pavidi vecordesque in primam pugnantium aciem procurrunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:8:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 24, 8, 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">also: deformis habitu more vecordium in publicum evolat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:7:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 7, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:55:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 55, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impetus prope vecors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pertinacia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:2:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vecordior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 40" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 40</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">med.—Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">istius vaecordissimi mentem terrebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:55:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 55, 141</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 274, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vecta: <entryFree id="n50276" type="main" key="Vecta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vecta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. Vectis.</entryFree>
vectabilis: <entryFree id="n50277" type="hapax" key="vecta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vectābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vecto</etym>, <sense id="n50277.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that can be carried</hi>, <hi rend="ital">portable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">materia insulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:25:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 25, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

vectaculum: <entryFree id="n50279" type="main" key="vecta_cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vectācŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50279.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a carriage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vehicle</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Bapt. 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Anim. 53</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vectarius: <entryFree id="n50280" type="hapax" key="vecta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vectārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50280.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">for carrying</hi> or <hi rend="ital">conveying</hi>: equus, <hi rend="ital">a packhorse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">draught-horse</hi>, Varr R. R. 2, 7, 15 (acc. to Schneid. we should read vectuarius).</sense></entryFree>
vectatio: <entryFree id="n50281" type="main" key="vecta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vectātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50281.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a carrying</hi> or <hi rend="ital">being carried</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a riding</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">vectatio et iter reficiunt animum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 17:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 17, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">assidua equi post cibum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 3</bibl></cit>.—Also in <hi rend="ital">act.</hi> sense, <hi rend="ital">a carrying</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bearing</hi>: sarcinae, Aug.
